Their menu includes vegetarian dishes, beer brats cooked and marinated on the spot, a ton of different variances of their hot dog recipes! They also have sausages for the hot & spicy lovers out there. Their Italian fries are a basket OD garlic-y goodness! I highly recommend extra crisy shoestring fries! Perfect addition to any hot dog combination! I also tried their Vegas fries! This isn't for the light-hearted French fry lover; or even the heavy hearted (HIGH IN CALORIES, but good!) but if a friend orders them, grab a fork and grab a bite! Definitely worth a try!

I will have to come back to try the rest of their colorful palette of hot dogs and fries! Their great customer service bumps them up a star also! Go great with Great Links! :)

As first timers we looked forward to trying this place out. We didn't realize that we'd have to know beforehand exactly what we wanted to eat and that we should refrain from looking over the whole menu to choose what we wanted. The server was an impatient jerk who made it blatantly clear that we were inconveniencing him in some way. He appeared annoyed and rushed us making us feel a little stupid that we didn't know we were supposed to know what type of fries we wanted. If we had a nickel for every sigh he made during our order, it would've paid for dinner. If it weren't for having a hungry child in tow, we would have walked out midorder. To top it off, this gem of a server had the same blue rubber gloves on that he used to handle food with during the order. The same ones he had on during check out for other people and the same ones he brought soda with. Not the cleanest. Other patrons expressed the same annoyance to this guy's demeanor. Who knows why he was such a jerk.

Food was ho hum, especially since we felt so unwelcomed and rushed at 6pm on a Monday night. Not as we had anticipated at all. Horrible experience. Plus side, there was a kids menu. Will never go back or recommend to anyone.

We went in for food after being in the heat for hours  only to be met with long wait and a rude server who refused one of my parties ID and declared in a peer tone that it was not their identification! After the serve went to retrieve our drink orders someone else brought my friend's drink out separately and asked for them to produce their ID again and scrutinized over it for a min! So not only did they not come to take our food order in a timely manner they insulted us by fighting with my friend over her identity!
Every time my boyfriend and I eat here they remember us! It feels like home and always has delicious food! Can't ask for more:)
Omg there so good and awsome I feel in love with this place service is awsome I got full with 1 hot dog good portions ..

My husband and I went there on Sunday for lunch. I ordered the ball park dog, which has mustard, ketchup, relish and onions.. sounds good-hmm, and beer battered onion rings with a diet pop.  My husband ordered a kielbasa sausage, Italian fries and a diet pop.  Lets start off with the chopped onion on my hotdog!  the onion was chopped in quite large pieces and there were WAY TOO MANY PEICES ON ONE HOTDOG!! It tasted like they used the relish that has the cloves in it, so I didn't care for the relish on there, and they put soooo much mustard on it and barely any ketchup at all.. all in all, I was very disappointed with my hotdog.  The onion rings were quite tasty, light and crispy, just the way I like them.  My husbands purchase, well it came on a bun with the sausage cut into four small pieces, he took one out and it is the way they cooked it! so it kept falling apart on him, they didn't drain the sauerkraut that was put onto it so the bun got very soggy.. I don't know if anyone else likes sauerkraut juice dripping from your bun, but he sure didn't.  His Italian fries came with some kind of Italian seasoning and parm. cheese and olive oil. They put so much olive oil on his fries that when he was done eating them, there had to be at least a half a cup of oil in the bottom of his dish, they put way too much oil on them... he was very disappointed with both the sausage and the fries that he ordered... when we first got there he asked them to turn the tv down, we were really close to it, and they turned it down one... they have two tvs in there and my husband and I were the only customers in there at the time he asked them to turn it down, so that just wasn't right of them... when we first walked in and the waitress came and took our order I noticed she had gloves on, I was thinking that was good.. If I had realized that they don't change their gloves in between orders.. (they didn't that day while we were there) we would have asked them to change them. The guy that was working was walking around running his hands along the counters and knocking on the counters and touching it seemed everything then he didn't change his gloves when other people came in there... she didn't either.  We definitely will not be back to this place.. THE ONLY REASON I PUT TWO STARS ON HERE IS BECAUSE THEY DID HAVE GOOD ONION RINGS!
Wow. Great menu, and everything we've tried has been delicious. Fair prices, good service, and a nice selection of beer. I definitely recommend you give this place a try.
"Super yummy sausages and nice, fresh tomatoes and excellent dill relish! Great variety between dogs, sausage and burgers. Fun sides and really nice people! Go check them out so they stay open!"

I had a burger that was good, nothing life changing. Wife had fish and chips that were pretty good. They came directly out of the deep fryer piping hot. Fry sauce is delicious. Staff is really nice. Large menu to choose from. Will be back to try more item.

I don't know why they don't have 5 stars because this place does not disappoint! I'm a vegetarian and the vegetarian hot dogs taste like real hot dogs....I can't get enough. The Buffalo cheesy fries are amazing, get them EVERY TIME I go. And I just tried the jalape√±o poppers...WOW. The cook by the bar was so nice too while my boyfriend and I were eating. They're all so kind. Love it and will always be back for more of course!

The Skinny: large selection of menu items, reasonable prices, phenom artisan root beer (4) service: efficient, friendly (4) value: pretty reasonable considering the quality (4).

We were scouring around town to find a great place for hot dogs and so far fell short... until Great Links.

The first time we ate here, we were literally overwhelmed by the selection here. I mean in addition to hot dogs, you have burgers, sammys, a selection various fried items smothered with a different toppings and salads. And for you vegetarians out there, they have a mighty fine selection of veggie kielbasa, bratwurst, italian sausage, hamburgers. I've never heard of veggie kielbasa, but I thought that was a pretty brilliant thing.

Personally, being of the meat eating persuasion, I ordered myself a grilled chicken salad. Yeah boring I know. But honestly, my company was instituting this whole exercise/eat right initiative and I felt obligated to participate. (I have since fallen off the bandwagon.) Really at a place like this, I wasn't really expecting much because it is a burger/hot dog joint after all. I was surprised though. Although it's romaine, it's clearly freshly chopped (note, none of that early brownish tinge you get when it's been cut a long time ago) with other veggies.They have a very simple oil and vinegar dressing that hit the spot. Plus, the chicken was plentiful and moist. For less than $7, it's far superior to many grilled chicken salad in the same price range.

The hubs couldn't help but try their artisan root beer. For us soda drinkers, it's got that real root beer-ish, herbacious flavouring (in an absolutely good way) that brought us back to the good ol' days. A must try!

Not being on a company diet, the hubs has had the rueben, their KC Masterpiece Nascar special featuring Boarshead sausage, their italian sausage and side orders of their fried zucchini, regular shoestring fries and freshly cut french fries. Their reuben was pretty great while the KC Masterpiece Nascar special was a little overwhelming with all the cheese, BBQ sauce on it - it kind of detracted from the flavours of the sausage. Regardless, their plainer renditions fare better - the casings got a nice snap to it.

The sides were a hit or miss. The fried zucchini's batter was a little too heavy and fell apart when you picked it up. Their fresh cut fries don't have quite the crispiness that I look for in a french fry. I prefer their shoestring fries which were much crispier and lighter -- FYI - their shoesting is more the size of your standard McDonald's french fries. 

Overall, given the price, I would definitely recommend this place for a good tuck in of hot dogs and root beer (4).

First time here. Came because they were four star on Yelp. Told them it was our first time and asked what they would recommend. Guy said we have a lot just look over the menu. Really?? No personal recommendations. Not that impressed. Mozzarella sticks and fries from a frozen bag and tasted like it, no special seasoning or anything. Burger was good but I was hoping for a delicious juicy burger. Left a little disappointed based on four stars and reviews.

Great food terrible service. 
Elizabeth is horrible. She never listens when we place our order she's served us 3 times and every time something is wrong. I could understand the mix up if they were busy but they weren't. She doesn't do check backs with us so we have to finish our food without a drink refill while she sits around.

Well I have had yelp for a while and have never written a review ... the food was amazing however the service was not . The girl that waited on us didn't greet us , say who we were speaking with and assumed we knew everything upon arrival .  She acted like a child, literally threw my burger on the table without saying a word and walked away. We did nothing to deserve this animosity. The food was incredible and I would definitely come back..... just without a different server .

i ordered the chicken Caesar salad sandwich when i went and it was stellar. i will be back again and again !!! they have such a huge selection of stuff i don't know how anyone wouldn't be able to find something delicious on the menu!
Had the hot dog with sauerkraut and chili cheese fries, both delicious! Will come back with the kiddos. Only thing is....the place is a little small and not much seating. So lunch time is busy.

Located very close to where I live and have shopped at neighboring businesses but never stopped here.  Went last night and what a surprise!  Had no idea they would have such an extensive menu.  Robert was awesome - watched him interact with other customers and his customer service was the best!!  Had the Cheese Steak Philly Style - Excellent!  Will be making Great Links a regular stop on my way home from work!
The best grilled cheese sandwich you can get in Las Vegas. Especially with bacon.
Popped in here because I needed a cheap bite to eat and saw the good yelp reviews. I was not disappointed. The burgers are even better than they look. I'll be back here when I visit Vegas next.
Best shake, burger and chili cheese fries ever. Our waitress Michelle was even better

Really had a craving for a hot dog and my friend had mentioned this place numerous times, so after getting my hair done on a Saturday, I ventured out to find this place.  It is really small. Not many tables, and some bar seating...by bar I mean food bar (diner ish, not alcohol).   I ordered the Kraut dog which came with mustard, onions, and sauerkraut, and then I wanted some tater tots with nacho cheese added. I like that they give you the option of liquid cheese, or shredded/melted cheese when you add them to a side. They also had a variety of fries, and sides.  The tots came out first and they were cooked good..not falling apart each time I pick one up with my fork. The dog came out just after and the snap on the hot dog was fantastic! It was loaded with sauerkraut, onions, and mustard! They don't skimp AT ALL!   I paid $3.75 or $3.95 for the dog, and around $2.95 or something for the tots. My total with drink was $11.50 or so and I was stuffed for the next 5 hours!  Amazing food and portions! Wish there was one in Henderson!

Perhaps my trip this restaurant was just a stray from the norm, or perhaps the people that review this place have never been to a quality burger and dog type place. 

I gave this restaurant a fair shot and was excited based on Yelp reviews. Yelp rarely fails me but this was one of those times where it fell short of expectations. 

Is there a good-ole-boy system at this place? All I heard the owner talking about was their award winning burgers to whom I supposed are the regulars. My wife, daughter and I were the only people under the age of 50 there, so perhaps that explains why their food was so bland and flavorless. 

I ordered the pastrami, which was cooked really well. However, there was little taste. I have tried pastrami from dozens of restaurants and this was bottom-of-the-barrell in terms of taste. 

My wife ordered grilled cheese, which is impossible to screw up unless you're 4 years old or completely inept. It was solid, but she ordered it with bacon and bacon saves everything. The bread was alright, but seemed store-bought. 

My daughter ordered chicken nuggets and she said they were disgusting. I looked at them and they appeared to be the type you buy from a frozen food section. 

We shared fries, which apparently do not come with any sort of salt or seasoning. 

To be fair, the waitresses there were super friendly and on top of their game. I hope the owner realizes this and recognizes them accordingly. 

What I found off-putting on a personal level was that the owner came out and greeted every single table, asked about their experience and bragged about their food.... except for our table. He also missed a kid run into the restaurant, grab two soda cups, fill them and leave without paying. All because he was too busy bragging about his food to the NASCAR crowd that was infesting this place. 

One of the cooks also took the time to venture into the diner and talk about the burger competition they had previously won. he oddly went out of his way to state that "I don't think they'll want us back next year. Not that we're cheating but..." and I didn't catch the end. 

Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this place considering the positive reviews on yelp. I will eventually give this place another chance to redeem itself and, if it isn't able to, I'll suspect that they are asking friends and family to circumvent the yelp reviews. 

Either that or they rarely get anyone who isn't an AARP member and can actually handle salt and seasoning.

I loved the food here!! I got the mob boss dog with a garlic sausage, a whole dill pickle and shoe string cut fries with fry sauce. Omg!!! It was sooooo bomb!!! No complaints! I can't wait to come back :) 
Great food, great service! Loved it!!

The family loves everything we have tried! Burgers and Tenders are great. Kids love the cheese steak and chicken sandwhiches. The favorite of the many sides have been the cottage fries. Oh, and they even have draft rootbeer!

We all wanted to get together and grab a bite to eat, but couldn't agree on a place to go. Finally, we decided to try somewhere new and this place popped up on yelp places near us. We all met up there and I have to say, I thought this place was going to be a lot bigger and more of a sit down dining place like a Red Robins or Applesbees since it's a Brewhouse and grill. It's a lot smaller than I was expecting. There wasn't a whole lot of room in there. Just one row of seating so you want to make sure you go at a good time or you won't be able to dine in and will have to get your stuff to go. They have a wall of bottles of beer that you can choose from. I was disappointed that we came in on a Friday night and they were out of their root beer on tap which is supposed to be one of the best things to try so I wasn't even able to get any like I wanted to. The food is a hit and miss. We all got different things to share so we could try a bunch of the menu items. Some things were really good and others I didn't really care for. I did really like the fried green beans. They'd probably be the only thing out of the things we did try, that I would go back to get. I got the pastrami cheeseburger and I can't say that I was impressed with it. The burgers weren't the best thing. Others got some of the sausages and hot dogs and they thought they were good. I also got the fried pickles. I love pickles, but they fry whole spears instead of slices and I think it was too much pickle and not enough breading. The customer service was ok. He came to check on us a few times before we got our food, but not so much after. We had to get up and refill our own drinks since he wasn't coming around. Not sure if we were supposed to or not. I think the place is worth a shot. They do have some good food and good flavors, but I don't think everything is great there so just go with whatever your gut tells you to try. I think I'll go back to try the pineapple sausage that I didn't get last time, but wish I would've over the burger.

As we were watching a movie my partner and I watched someone eat a hot dog so next thing you know we're yelping to find a good hot dog place. Since I don't eat beef I called around to a couple places to see if they served turkey dogs (yes I know I'm going to get stuff for eating a turkey dog but whateves). Great links had turkey options AND vegetarian options which is awesome! As soon as we got here we were greeted(can't remember his name :() but he was really nice and even made suggestions since we've never been here. I ordered a Chicago dog and a root beer float(delish, have one). My partner ordered a mob boss with a order of chili cheese fries. Everything was on point!!! A must have!!!

This. Place. Rocks.

We went there last Saturday after a trying week drove us to junk food and movies. We are Vegan, so finding places to eat out was a challenge. HappyCow.net had them listed, and we were stoked they were right up the street. Complete with a hearty vegan selection in addition to their carnivore options, the menu was lookin' pretty svelte for one who intends to smash food in their face without regret.

This is the kind of neighborhood place you go to not be prissy pants, to chat with the cook and waitress, to just eat till your fat and happy. I had the vegetarian Chicago dog and the husband had the vegetarian Italian sausage. Oh... man... it was so good we finished our dogs before our fries and zucchini sticks came out of the fryer. 

Great Links is a Great Option for blended friends and families! (some vegan, some vegetarian, some carnivore)

This place is awesome... Some of the best dogs I've had... A lot of different choices done up however you like... The Philly cheese is on a "whole notha level" as Key & Peele would say... One of my new favorites spots that feel familiar when you walk in...
Ok. So we gave this place another try due to a coworkers recommendation. Wow it was great. Attentive service, delicious food, reasonable prices. Glad gave them another try.
The Italian fries are delicious, and I was super surprised by how great the Reuben I had today was. Always a great place to eat.

Just a small time diner with easygoing staff and atmosphere. You had a long day or just want some quick comfort food? This is a good spot. Effort is made 100% by them to provide great service.  Food is fried and very diner like so don't go in thinking this is a strip/fancy style restaurant with delacacies that will blow your mind! It's a place you can relax, get a beer, have a good dog or burger and watch the game in peace and good company. A little confusion with orders getting mixed from cooks but I can tell it's a new crew and they are gonna give it their all to get it together and be a smooth operating spot. Will def come again! Oh and try the fry sauce. It's bomb!

I love this place! It has become our go to weekend spot and the food never fails. Sundays can get pretty crazy and busy but the food is always consistent. I have never ordered anything that I haven't liked. Great food at great prices!

Me and my husband love the burgers here and we love that we can have tots instead of fries. Big juicy and flavorful. The fry sauce is a great bonus! Excellent service provided by Ashley, thanks Ashley for taking good care of us. We recommend trying. We will be back!

I ate at Great Links towards the end of a long trip in Las Vegas.  The only regret I have is that I didn't go sooner so that I could have gone there more then once.  The hot dogs were excellent and the fries and tater tots were as well.   I went to Pinks at Planet Hollywood earlier in the trip and it was average at best - not to mention way overpriced.   I don't know if I would prefer this place to Carney's in LA if they were side by side but in Vegas this is the place to get a very good hot dog!

we both ate their italian beef.lousy! in no shape or form is this a italian beef? tasteless,some strange beef meat,grilled green peppers suppossed to be steamed and at $9.50 expensive.2 drinks,2 beefs and one order of frys over $26.00!!! seating is terrible! won't ever go back.went their cause someone said delicious italian beef.evident guy ain't ever had italian beefs in chicago.doesn't know what he's talking about.

Burgers here were great! And so were the chili cheese fries. It says draft house, yet don't actually have any beers on draft. However, do have a pretty decent selection of beer, considering the dive type burger/hot dog shop. 
Either way I highly recommend this spot for a great bite to eat!

Simply less than mediocre.  If your thinking about going, do yourself a favor and don't.  You don't have to be a 5 star chef to put some semi creative toppings on a freaking hot dog.  The only reason I didn't leave pissed off as apposed to mildly disappointed was because the prices were cheap.  Maybe it was my fault for expecting so much for such a low price, I should have remembered the age old saying,"you get what you pay for".  But seriously people if you are craving a good hot dog either go to Pinks, or go to the store buy $10 worth of ingredients and get down with some good eats at home.  The End!

Well first off, I have been excited to try this place for awhile, and unfortunately was let down.

When I walked in I was planning on ordering take out, and stepped straight to the counter where the menu was.  There were two guys (cooks) there in the open kitchen behind the bar, and there was zero greeting, so I decided whatever and seated myself as the sign says.  A young lady comes out and greets me and takes my drink order.  I order a root beer (which I was not aware that it was the non-refill type), the root beer was quite good and the highlight of the meal, so I will give it that.

I look over the menu a little more and decide on the chili dog and chili cheese fries, which I figured I couldn't go wrong with.  This is where my disappointment began, now I was pretty hungry not having eaten for several hours because of traveling so again I was looking forward to this...the fries were over cooked, and the chili had little to no taste, even after adding salt and pepper.  I ate most of them because I was hungry and they cost me good money.  Next was the chili dog which I was already worried about because of the fries, the dog comes out and it is pretty plain, just chili on top and nothing too large for $4+ and so I take a bit and yep I was right nothing special, same no taste chili and the hotdog is just average (Costco has better hotdogs), the cheap bun falls apart half way through for no reason (it wasn't the chili) and so that make it even worse.  Truthfully I wanted to just get up and leave as my server (who was a nice girl) had disappeared, and the two cooks wouldn't have even noticed or cared.  But I finished most of my meal and paid and left.

I wont be going back as there is nothing to go back for, tasteless food, average service, below average atmosphere.  And inflated pricing for what you get.  This is sad for me when I had great expectations for a locally owned place.

Yum yum yum yummy yum! Finally a place where vegetarians can feel like home. For each menu selection, you have the ability to get a veggie version. Hot dogs, burgers, sausage, bacon...they carry soy based selections for everything! Friendly waitress, laid back atmosphere and most meals under $8!

One of my favorite places in Vegas. I'd eat here daily if I could. The fries are amazing, the bratwurst and Italian sausage is to die for! I always get mob boss style. Sooo good. I go here all the time when I'm in Vegas and thankfully I'm moving back soon. This place and Monta are my favorite places in the city.

Staff: very busy but nice.

Food:
- I ordered the Ball Field Dog and French fries,
The buns were very soggy, the dog was very hard and tasted weird.
The fries were greasy....

- My friend ordered a veggie dog, it was very dry....

I got sick couple hours later ( I have a sensitive stomach though...) 
Not my type of hot dogs...never again.

I think even weinersnitchel tastes better...

Yelpers, I don't understand the 4 stars...

As I said, the staff was busy but polite....

I know, I know. Who goes to a place named Great Links Brewhouse and orders a Burger and ice water.  Well... that was me today.  Hey, they do have a sticker on the entrance and throughout the place that they competed on Burger Wars sponsored by Fox 5 so they must have decent Burgers.  

I went with the Pastrami burger which was slightly over cooked with grilled onions, spicy mustard and melted provo with pastrami piled on top of a 1/3 LB meat patty.  Good combo, I do like a little heavier mustard on mine which I added. Besides the burger having a char to it this definitely satisfied my burger craving I had today.  

To accompany my burger I went with the Italian Fries topped with Italian seasoning and grated parmesan cheese. These were tasty fries.  The parmesan began melting which made them even better half way through the meal.  

Overall visit was solid, I will be back to try one of there monster dogs.  They have several varieties of topping combinations including the classic Chicago Style.  I think my first choice will be the chili dog. I saw one being brought to another table and I almost had to change my mind.

The inside of the bar was really special and it carried a nice atmosphere. However, the food was "typical bar food" now this may sound terrible but if you are looking for 5 star atmosphere this is the place but if you are expecting Red Robin type food this is why the 3 star rating

Broaden you menu guys you have the makings of a downtown Summerlin competitor

Great Links is one of my favorites - and - its family owned and operated (+++). We eat really enjoy eating lunch or dinner here when were in the area. It has a fun and energetic atmosphere with an open cooking area. The menu has something to offer everyone - check out their Vegetarian Section and choices of beverages/bottled beer.¬†


My daughter loves watching our food cook from the high top bar area that over looks the grill not to mention the food & service is 100% spot on every time!¬†


The cheese tatertots were crispy and fired to perfection. I ordered the Slaw Dog with an upgraded Hogue bun - totally worth the¬†$2¬†charge. My daughter had the plain dog but their kid meal options are only¬†$4¬†which includes fries and a drink. The BBQ cheese burger was nice and juice. Everything we wanted and more!

Stellar burgers, pastrami, chili cheese fries, hot dogs, shakes. Staff was Nice. Clean! 

I love open plan kitchens where u can talk to your chef. Totally unpretentious. If ur a "junk foodie" you'll love this place.

One of only a few mom and pop burger joints in LV with a lot of care put into their "fast food" I would eat here three times a week if it was closer to me.

It has been a while since I was here but didn't get around to writing a review until now.  I found it a bit off putting that the server had a thong string hanging out but I didn't want to be a prude.  The wait to be served was crazy long.  When I finally placed my order she never brought my drink and I had to go up to the bar and ask for it.  At the end of our meal I saw the guy behind the bar giving himself a shot of whip cream out of a can - then using the same can to finish someone's shake.  Gross.  That has to be a health violation!  And by the way- the food was forgettable.

Amazing $5 lunch. This is an little place tucked into a strip mall. The staff is very nice and the menu is big. I recommend the $5 Special, you get a hot dog, corn dog, fries, soda and either chicken nuggets or grilled cheese. What a deal and everything was really good. If this was closer to my house I would eat here all the time!

This is our second time eating at Great Links.  The first time was 6 months ago and not a good experience.  Tried it again today and worse, so here is our review.

We sat down and the waitress/cashier took our order.  5 minutes later we received our 2 orders of fries, which was ok, but the rest of our food didn't arrive for another 15 minutes.  So basically the fries were almost cold when our hotdogs arrived.  We then received the rest of our food but one order was completely wrong.  The waitress apologized and sent it back to the cook, but it was another 10-15 minute wait for them to make it again.  Fries are now ice cold at this point.  No offer to give us a discount, get us hot fries, nada.  

Went to the counter to pay and now another person emerged from the back.  He printed our receipt, I handed him my debit card, he charged it and handed it back for me to sign.  All this without saying ONE WORD to us.  No hi, thank you, how was your meal, have a nice day......nothing.  I walked out thinking "what a jerk".  

The waitress was very nice, but everything else was less than satisfactory.  I'll normally give a place two times before we zap them from our restaurant list.  They've been zapped......

Ohhh I wanted to like it! We live in Henderson, so it took a lot to convince my roommate to drive the 30 miles one way -- I had to offer to pay LOL so off we went. I ordered NY Street Dog, waffle fries & BBQ Western Burger w/bacon. I have to admit when the food got to the table, in the cute little bar style baskets -- I turned to my roommate and said "disgusting". It was so gross, to me (and I'm from the west coast) but it was all Chicago style -- like a mess. It wasn't the type of food you can just pick up and eat, the bun - from both the hot dog and the burger were just saturated, wet, soggy, mushy like dough like gross - which is where my "disgusting" game from. So the hotdog was some type of pressed meat type of hot-dog, like a cheap hot dog and it was not grilled. It was not a good, high quality hot dog at all. What I didn't like was it was all pink - inside and out I don't know I like my hotdogs grilled with like grill marks on the outside. This dog sat down in the soggy bun covered with sour croute and mustard. I bit off the one end and pushed the hotdog over to my roommate. He cut his burger in half and gave me half - same thing, and I wanted to take a picture but I felt silly - it was a big piece of mush. Seriously like ¬æ of it had been dipped in BBQ sauce........... It seems like the BBQ burger had some kind chili on it or something but it was all over saturated with BBQ/Chili sauce. I took a bite, the burger itself seemed like a good burger - and I did like the actual meat of the burger itself but as the BBQ sauce got all over my hands and fingers it was a mess, yucky - I set the rest of the burger in its basket and pushed it away. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands. Oh ya and they were out of waffle fries - so we opted for the "natural" fries, which ya, were very greasy. We ate all of the fries, because we were hungry and both of us not too happy with the meals - the little sauces that came with the fries was good  some kind of Cajun sauce and what seemed to be tarter.

Like I said I wanted to like this place, I like the d√©cor and the waitress was very nice but this place is not my style. I'll continue on my personal search for a great Las Vegas burger.
Love this place!!! Didn't look like much walking in, but the food & variety are outstanding. People are extremely friendly & they go out of their way to make sure your experience is fantastic.

Great place to eat good portions big menu its always a struggle to decide everything I've had here has been excellent from cheese frys to the links amazing. Only thing its a small space and I have a big fam and it gets pretty crowded sometimes but over all the food and service trumps all. They also serve one of my fav beers on tap amber bock plus a good bottled selection highly recommend.

Easily one of the best "hot dog/sausage" centric diners I have visited.  But, don't just focus on the tube meats. The sandwiches (pastrami, cheese steak, Chicago beef) and burgers are amazing too. The quality of the meats and large array of toppings are the difference makers; great recipes and service of hot and flavorful dishes are the best!!! Working our way thru the menu has been an adventure full of outstanding eats. Definitely try the white chili on dogs, sausages or burgers. Any of the fries are perfect - hot and super crisp. Can you tell I like this place???  LOL. Great service and
a super talented chef along with willingness to make anything you can think of as toppings or prep make this an easy choice. Owned a small barbecue place myself, and these folks really hit every single mark.

Decided while I was on that side of town to try this place, since I noticed they had won on Burger Wars on FOX NEWS. I am sure glad I did! The food was AMAZING! Service was Great! It was worth the trip out there (even though I was all ready on this side) My Burger was the best! I'll be back! Thank You for such a great Experience and I can see why you have won three years running!

We just ate here and can tell it's going to be one of our favorite places! The staff were super friendly and te atmosphere was relaxed. I had a Philly dog and my husband had a jersey hot sausage with onions. These had to be the best we have ever had!

My brother came to visit from LA and he always uses Yelp... So he found this place and said there was good reviews and we would try it... We went and LOVED IT!! I have been back many times since. I just don't recommend going when they first open.

Now Great Links is not a place I think most people should visit more than a few times a year. Yes, the menu items are very tempting and on days when you are craving calorie adding and artery clogging foods, this is the place to go. 
I was excited to see they offer veggie options and that is what I ordered: vegetarian chili and vegetarian hot dog plus a side salad. Most other items are fried, covered in cheese and sauces. I see this place as somewhere to stop by to watch the game, have a beer and eat some fried foods. 
The open kitchen with the bar next to it is very inviting to chat with the employees. There aren't very many seats other than that so maybe getting items to go is another option.
The restaurant could use a deep cleaning on the floors and such- it felt a bit grimy to me. 
Also, I saw an employee serve himself a fountain drink and drink it in the kitchen. Later the same employee scratched his head/neck while behind the counter next to the stove.
 I don't know, the heavy greasy foods and the lack of cleanliness of the place are enough for me to pass on this as a choice next time I am in the area.

I absolutely LOVE Great Links. Now that I've moved from Vegas, I miss it all of the time. I used to eat here for lunch on the weekends, now I wish I'd gone even more. It's a small establishment on Craig Rd near 95, reminds me of a diner. They have many other options besides hot dogs, including brats and chicken, with vegetarian selections as well. There's a decent selection of beers, mostly bottles, and root beer on tap!

I always get the veggie dogs, and I wish I knew what brand they used. They taste better and have better texture than all other vegetarian hot dogs. The Chicago dog is my fav, and I also love the NY dog with sauerkraut and mustard. I definitely recommend trying their white Vegas chili, whether it's on fries or a dog. Sausage and sage is an awesome combination and it's delicious. Also, cannot get enough of the grillmaster fries, oh my they're addictive. 

The service is always great. This place draws a local crowd, seems like many people know the owners/employees. I've had many different waiters/waitresses, eventually a few times each. Everyone is friendly and attentive.

I miss it so much ... keep up the great food and service and thanks for the memories! Don't change a thing!

Great Links is a great place for a great meal.  I love the food choices, and I especially love the people that work there.  You can get a snappy dog with tons of toppings for cheap, and some killer fries, including my favorite--the Grill Master Fries (it's an acquired taste, though): fries tossed with thousand island dressing, grilled onions, then topped with melted cheese.  Ew?  Maybe.  For me?  Yum. :)

If you want a nice place to run in and eat, check them out.  And if you're brave enough, grab some grill master fries. Don't blame me if you think it's crazy and weird. I warned ya!

Once a summer, I allow myself the childhood pleasure I rarely indulge in HOT DOGS!

Ohmygosh, a girlfriend and I walked into this place after repeating the name several times and giggling. Let's do it, I ordered the "New Jersey" in honor of my roommate Steve who is from Jersey. It included delic green peppers, onions, mustard and ketchup with a perfectly crispy bun. I was in hot dog heaven, it seriously hit the spot. The spiciness with those onions. Score!

What a great hangover cure, HOT DOGS. 
Who would think it? :)

Today was the first time I've been to this place, so it took me awhile to read through the menu to decide. The server was understanding, brought me my drink, and let me work my way through the menu. 

They have many choices for hot dogs, sausages and burgers along with many other choices, I almost ordered fish and chips.They had a chili burger, normally I make sure whether it's chili the red soup stuff or chili the green pepper, reading the description it said white chili, since I had no idea what that was, I asked the server. She brought me a sample. It's made with a sage sausage, it's a lot like the country gravy I make for biscuits and gravy.

I ended up ordering a patty melt. Cheese, grilled onions, burger on grilled dark rye. It was good, not great, but good. The burger patty was lacking, it appeared to be a frozen formed patty, dry after cooking. The preparation, of the sandwich, was great, with a fresh burger patty, that was still juicy, it would have been a great sandwich.

The server, I didn't get the name, an attractive young lady at lunch time on 6/19/2014. She was friendly, helpful, attentive, everything a person in customer service should be. 

I've read all the reviews, they allude to the burgers winning awards, so my burger may have been an aberration. I would say, I will go back and try a burger again, but after reading the reviews about the snap in the dogs, I want to try one of them. Funny thing is, I saw the Great Links sign and I actual went in this place for a hot dog, got lost in the menu and ended up ordering a burger.

I believe the 1/2 lb patty melt, I had, was about $7.50, which is about the going price for this type of sandwich, so the price is reasonable.

I will be back, you should give it a try.

Between the Chicago dog and the Italian sausage, this place is doing it right. Try the Italian fries, definitely delicious with the root beer.
Beer battered fried mushrooms are also a hit for me.
They have fast and friendly service even on the busiest of afternoons.

Me and my girlfriend were in the other side of town the other day and decided to try something different. The ambiance was pretty casual and everybody seemed really nice. I ordered a Bacon burger and a chili cheese dog, and my girlfriend just ordered a chili cheese dog.

The food was really mediocre considering it was $6.50 for a burger and $5 for a hot dog. If we were a couple of dollars cheaper I probably would have been okay with it. 

The reason I'm giving it 3 stars because I cook behind the counter never changed his gloves and was wiping his face with sweat the whole time. Luckily the meal tasted good. 

Not sure if I'm coming back due to the fact that the prices were pretty high for just a burger and hotdog. And if that guy keeps working here I will not be coming back because that place looks very unsanitary due to no changing of any gloves.
I can't even begin to explain how awesome this place is, a colleague recommended it and it's amazing, I definitely don't go often enough, their food is awesome and all the employees are really cool!

I originally started going to great links for lunch and dinner but one day I stumbled in there earlier in the day and discovered a breakfast menu. I lucked out that day because the breakfast is delicious. They serve fresh eggs potatoes biscuits and gravy and you get any link you choose to add to
Your breakfast. The staff is nice and friendly and your sure to have a good time. Sometimes it's gets busy and its wait but well worth it. Long story short anytime of the day you can go to great links and enjoy a good hearty meal

So my husband wanted some awesome hotdogs, so after searching thru Yelp and reading their reviews we decided to give this place a try. Have to say that I'm so glad we did. It was a great find and now one of our favorite places to eat. The food and the service was great, and they serve beer!! Lol.. They have a great menu as far as choices for the hotdog, and they taste like a little piece of heaven, they are made fresh to order and serve right away. This is a grill and it is a bit small with only a few tables are available, but is worth waiting if you have too.

My new home away from home!  Hot Dogs - one of my favorite foods, and Great Links hasn't let me down once!  What a menu!  So hard to decide what to order, but one thing I know for sure, their Cottage Fries (potato chips) ROCK!  Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!
The best everything we try we love always fresh and hot when we order pick up it still steaming when we get home got to try this place !!!!!!!

I have to agree, Ashley is an amazing server. My mom and I had stopped in earlier in the week and it was my first visit. I had a Bratwurst and my mom had the Italian beef. I was very impressed, thought it was a cute small spot with good food. 
Tonight my daughter and I came back for a fun dinner on a girls night... They were very busy and only a few tables inside empty (they also have outdoor seating and a nice diner style bar)  Ashley was our server and their were two cooks, I thought when we walked in we may be waiting a while. Boy was I wrong. We had our drinks in no time, placed our order and enjoyed the Razorback game on one TV and The Cubbies on the other. 
Our food was hot and fresh. As soon as our food came out of the fryer it was at our table and oh it was Wonderful!! Fried mushrooms in their beer batter was just the way to start. You must try the cottage fries which are really homemade chips!! 
Being from the Chicago land area, I know a good Chicago dog and this was over the top. My daughter had the fish and chips and absolutely loved it! 
Ashley had her hands full with all her tables, but you would have never known. She made it look like a breeze and we never felt neglected! She has a great personality and seems like she really enjoys her job!
Both the cooks were nice and doing an amazing job getting food out dast, fresh and yummy!! One of the cooks even brought my daughter over a cookie when we were getting ready to leave, which really made her night. On our way out ashley told her to have a good week at school!  On the way home she kept telling me how many of their other treats she was going to try next time. 
Can't wait to bring the hubby and kids in next weekend!!

This is just for the hamburger.. See my reviews for the other stuff.. I don't see how they won the burger wars.. It's a frozen patty and taste like it too! The lettuce became so soggy so fast it stopped my bite, it wouldn't tear at all, when I tried to bite into the burger the whole slice of lettuce came out without breaking off.. I tried to pull it apart with my hands and couldn't!! I'm not weak either.. I think I found something stronger than 550 cord. I was disappointed as everything else here is so awesome!

I've been several times, and recommend to everyone... however, I brought an out of towner this past weekend, and was pretty disappointed. I got the wrong drink, my burger was wrong, and we only got one of our fry orders. Hopefully the next trip way over there will be worth it...
Perfect little hole in the wall, located in the Lowe's parking lot. Very rarely many empty seats, an indication of how yummy the food is!

This place was very good.  I had the Las Vegas Dog.  The White sage chili that they mounded on the hot dog was most excellent.  I would have preferred my tomatoes diced instead of wedged, but that is a personal preference. The blending of the mustard and mayo was excellent as well. The service was ok.  When the staff was at our table it was very polite and pleasant.  However, they seemed to have a serve by team approach and we were inconsistent in getting service to our table.  Food was great.
Great food and service. Very friendly staff.   Great variety of food.  Bratwurst is fantastic!!!

Found this on Yelp.  Amazed to find that it was a former Famous Uncle Al's since we come from Virginia Beach, the birthplace of the Uncle Al franchise.  Great links has expanded on Al's menu in a good way and we all enjoyed our picks from the big menu.  if you are in Virginia Beach, stop in the original Famous Uncle Al's on Shore Drive and meet the man himself - it's an experience.

Awesome little hot dog resturant on the north end of town! 

I went with the Philly cheese steak. It came on a warm bun with smothered onions, mushrooms, and provolone cheese. Packed with flavor galore. On the side I ended up going with the tater tots which came out crisp and perfectly salted however I would like to try these shoestring potatoes next time I come here.

The service here was top notch all around. The waitress helped me navigate the menu as there was soooooo many hot dogs on the menu that looked delish.

Can't wait to try some of the other sandwiches on the menu.

Went to this restaurant on my lunch break since a friend had recommended it to me. I was not disappointed at all! Sat down, placed my order and it was cooked right in front of me. I went with the philly griller dog and a side of italian fries. The griller dog was very good. The italian fries can use less parmesan cheese on them but thats just my personal taste so not taking a star away. The staff was real friendly and ready to refill my drink when needed. Food is cooked to order so don't expect fast food. Will definitely be back soon to try one of their other menu items.
Good service, good food, get on down there, awesome love the fries fresh. The service was great waiter real nice.

PW wanted wieners and when he's hungry, you're better off just going with the flow. Besides we had to give him an opportunity to make up for his food court fiasco the other day. Good call! I too am now a fan of the wiener.

Our waitress, Michelle, greeted us promptly, took our drink orders, and made a few suggestions for the midday meal. We went with three different kinds of french fries as appetizers and all were outstanding. Cheesy buffalo, buttery garlic, and grilled onions had us all drooling when they were brought to the table. 

I opted for the Philly Griller. Covered with grilled peppers and onions, it was quite possibly the best tube steak I've ever consumed. PW got some sort of chili dog, as did IW (no relation). 

They have root beer on tap as well as draft beers. Definitely coming back for a bite and a brew. Lunch for three was just north of thirty bucks and worth much more. This place gets pumping at lunch time but is definitely worth a short wait. Their menu is pretty extensive including burgers, fish and a variety of sausages.

A five-star experience all around. Even if you're not a fan of the wiener you'll be sure to find something to please your palate.
Great hot dog and sandwich place in my neighborhood. Nice little beer selection too. The fried pickles are good. Check this place out if your craving a good hot dog.

This place has quickly become one of my favorite places to dine. It's an American grill, so your needs for burgers or hot dogs is covered. I've been here on several occasions and find it difficult trying to order something new because of the certainty of what I ordered in the past will not disappoint. 

I'll find myself wanting to come here when I want an all out hot dog topped with all my favorites. Bar seating area so sit yourself if you need to. Staff is always friendly and checking up if you need drink refills or anything else.

Being the only non-meat-eater in the house - I'm normally limited to salads, grilled cheese or fries when we go eat out for a quick lunch. This place was definitely a compromise with a great reward! 

They will substitute any menu item that has meat in it with the vegetarian option of it (veggie chicken patty, burger patty, bacon, and chili)...they can also substitute turkey too.

The food the rest of the family had was enjoyed just as much...will definitely be back! Staff was great and place was clean.

The only thing I would recommend is that if your at a table where there is veggie and non-veggie orders being placed - order the veggie item first as there was a gap of about 10 minutes between the food coming out. (they do indicate on their menu that veggie items take a few minutes longer).

Hands down the fries are amazing. We order "The Deluxe Fries". The atmosphere is great. However I ordered a "cheese chili dog" and it was just average. And we also ordered "the streets of New York" and it was great. I will be going back again for sure.

We love this place! It has a huge menu. We go here about twice a month. They have great side. Also lots of different dogs and burgers. I don't know how the waitresses keep up but I always feel taken care of.

This is a great place, fantastic hot dogs, and burgers. 
And many more items on the menu.
The service was great, the food was excellent, and the prices were fair.

They are in a big strip mall with a Lowes, but if you weren't looking for them, like I was, you might not see that they were there.  They need a bigger sign.

No bueno... The food here was very bland to me. When i think of great links I think spicy savory tasty and i didn't get any of that from this experience. This is not a place i will be back to since the food just didn't do it for me. 

The staff was nice but not enough to get them a higher rating since the food was so blah to me. Oh well

I've never lived in Chicago, but sometimes I sure miss Chicago Dogs. And though there are some places to get a reasonable interpretation of a Chicago Dog, none of them really hit it right in every single way...until now!

Uncle Al's uses their very own dogs and that's part of what makes this place so special. Their dogs "snap" when you bite in, just like a good Chicago dog should. (They have skinless for you wusses that don't understand the true nature of a good dog.)

Aside from Chicago, they have about another dozen styles of hot dogs -- all of them wrong except the Chicago. (Ketchup?? On a hot dog? Ew!) They also have a variety of other sandwiches and burgers, but if you have any sense in your head, you come here for the dogs.

Aside from the dogs, they have real french fries. They're kind of limp but for some reason, I still really like them. I've tried the coleslaw twice and regretted it twice. Stick to the dogs...and the limp fries.
Fist time eating here. Very pleased with the customer service and great staff. I ordered a massive 1/2 lb kielbasa and I'm stuffed. Delicious and definitely will return.
Great food, large portions, great price and great service. What else can you ask for? This was our first time here and Charlie helped us make some great choices.

All the hot dogs here are Boar's Head, but you can choose skinless or a turkey dog. Walking in there were several employees that greeted us. We chose a table near the window and started looking through the menu. The menu offers a variety of not just hot dogs, but also sausage, burgers, sandwiches, chicken, fish, and salad.  

Given the name, I had to try a hot dog the first time! Priced at $4.59 I ordered the "Philly Griller dog" that had grilled peppers, onion and cheese sauce. Yum! I couldn't even eat the whole thing so half went to hubby who didn't care for the char taste, but I like a good charred dog. The peppers and onions had a great flavor and there was a fair amount of cheese sauce. I also had some "Italian Fries" priced at $4.29 and had my choice of shoestring or crinkle-cut. I chose the shoestring and it was tossed in a garlic butter sauce and topped with parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning. These were good! I asked for a side of ranch to dip them in and the ranch was good. Our server was nice and checked on us often. I do feel the restaurant could be cleaner inside, but there was a good vibe and I'd go back. You can place your order for pick-up as well.
Great food and friendly staff.  I have never had a bad experience yet in 6 visits.  Highly recommend brats and Philly cheesesteaks but everything is good.

This place is a rough gem... Think very small diner, limited menu, but oh-so comfortable. It is a drive from the Strip for visitors, as well as it should be. I'm quite sure carnivores could find other glittery gimmicky "meat in tube form" onthe Strip; however, for me, its about the vegetarian options and supporting the local economy when visiting. And, the options were enough for a couple visits or infrequent visits. For a weekend visit to Vegas, my bro and I visited twice.

With that said, vegetarian options doesn't mean healthy. Nor do they or we profess to be healthy. The meals are "stick to your ribs" good tasty meals. This is a place where the carnivores and vegetarian friends can meet, share a table and watch the game. Beer, brats, and (foot/basket/base)balls.

I can't speak for my bro meals; I had the Mob Boss (grilled peppers, onions, marinara, and two mozzarella sticks) and a simple veg chili dog. Both were very tasty, wolfed them down on each occasion. Then we also shared the Grilled Master fries (similar to In-n-Out fries, animal style), buffalo cheesy fries (I liked this, could use a little more buffalo sauce), and zucchini (crispy breaded outside with well-done juicy inside) . Sides were definitely hit the spot.

Staff were friendly and helpful, but somewhat distant/nonattentive at times. Guess it was close to the holidays and they just want to have fun, too. Understandable.

So, if you want something tasty away from the glitz, this is one place.

The wife and I had a taste for a good dog. We decided on Great Links. I've never eaten there but the wife has used their takeout. I love a good dog and I wasn't disappointed. The wife had the  Louisiana Hot Link and I had my favorite the Chicago Dog. It was an excellent choice. Both were delicious. I was blown away that the fries stayed hot for the whole meal. Service was great. The young lady was on top of her game. I plan on eating there a lot. I will not go to another place for my Hot Dogs.

This hole in the wall place caught my eye and I am glad that I took a chance and tried it.  I am a big fan of burgers, but I don't eat them very often.  This casual place in a strip mall next to Lowes and Qdoba at Craig and Rancho has amazing food.  

This place was full at dinner time on a Friday night, and many of the customers seemed to be regulars.  I ordered the Ortega Bacon Cheese Burger (the name might be a little different, not sure) and it was great.  I did sub swiss for the pepper jack, and the result was a little less heat than I would have liked, but that's my fault. It was still delicious, with high quality ingredients.  

The shoestring fries were hot and fresh and one order is more than enough for two people.  Try it with one of their fry sauces.  I can't wait to go back and try one of their hot dogs, which they have made for them by Boar's Head.   

Two soft drinks, one order of fries, one burger and one cheesesteak cost about $19 before the tip.  The service very good, and they were prompt with refills.   

It is not a dive, but it is definitely a place where you will find people in flip flops and shorts.

The hot dogs were good. They have a wide variety.  There bacon cheeseburger is great. Fast service however I had to refill my own drink. The waitress just pointed to the machine and said she was too busy. That was a bummer. But as far as taste goes.......they get a 3 star.

I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger with Onion Rings.  It was nice.  There was a nice crowd already inside. The service was quick, I got my food fast.  But waiting for the check was a little bit of a wait as there was a steady stream of people coming in and going out.  I would definitely come back
Another great hot dog place; been there a few times. Great selection of hot dogs - chili, Chicago and Vegas dog are my favorites. Coupons in Entertainment Book
Great food, speedy and efficient service and great prices. Vegetarian options are good too

AWESOME-SAUCE!!!!
This was our first time here, so Charlie had us sit at the bar & briefly covered the whole menu for us & provided us w/ some info abut the place. He was SO nice! 
Hubby tried the chili dog & I had the Chicago dog (minus the sport peppers). They were DELICIOUS! i'm not a chili fan because I don't really care for beans. Well thiers was pork & didn't have any beans, so it was sooooo good!!
Also, I didn't know what sport peppers were & another guy working the grill turned around & handed us a small cup of them to try! ALL the employees there take care of you!!! Oh, thier fry sauce was awesome, too!
Will definitely be back! AND.......it looks like they are opening up one by the base in the old Blueberry Hill building! Can't wait!!

I am updating my review to post by far the WORST fucking customer service I have ever experienced. Which is extremely upsetting and disappointing considering I am a frequent patron of this place. The ONE time I call to advise of an issue I get an asinine excuse for customer service. 

I placed a multiple order pickup for my office and went to pick up on my lunch. I drove there paid then got back to work. Opened the boxes to find a sandwich was missing and received an extra order of fries. I called to advise and was at first gonna ask to pickup the sandwich but was immediately shot down and was basically called a liar. I was completely stumped as all the food went to one place and looking right at it and told him it wasn't in the bag. This "manager",Julian, kept arguing and refused to meet me half way of either refunding only the sandwich or make another for me to pick up. His excuse? They've been gypped before so. . . Ha, wow! He wanted me to bring the entire order back to "prove" I didn't get the item. Seriously? For one fucking sandwich? I seriously can't believe this place will treat a regular with such little respect. I get it - you want to believe you do everything right all the time - but we are all humans and prone to error. This one time shows me where they hold their customer base. Hold on tight to that $9 - you're losing much more than that with this experience. 

Like I said, it's shocking and extremely disappointing because when I typically go - I eat in with no error. I go once during the lunch rush and complain ONCE and get treated like some hooligan trying to rob the place. I will NEVER return and trust that I will spread the word of how fucking awful you treat your patrons. Food is good but not worth it in case you find an error that they refuse to take ownership for.

What better way to kick off the New Year by reviewing another local business!?
Also, since Yelp only allows you to rate 1-5stars and nothing in between, I've come up with a "Shaka-Meter" where it allows 0-10 Shakas ..\uuu/...and everything in between!

So we were in the area and have always passed Great Links, but this time, we stopped in for a bite. Locally owned and run, staff makes you feel at home. We split the Vegas Chili Dog and I got the Pastrami Cheeseburger. Wifey got a Bacon Cheeseburger and  we both got some delicious Death Valley Root Beer on tap! Woooohooo!!!

The burgers were okay, just too well done for my taste, but the star was the Vegas Chili Dog. I love the snap you get from each bite! We plan to return, but unless they cook burgers to a desired temperature, I'll just go down the hot dog side of the menu, or maybe even choose from the wide variety of menu items they have.   ALOHA!!!

Shaka-Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu   3.5

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(1/365) "Wassup Dog!?!?"

They allow you to make whatever your heart desires. Everything is a la carte, which is fine, you can mix and match. Prices are great for the quality of food. Owner is a very humble guy. Unless you asked, you would not know that he is who he is.

It was my 2nd trip here.  The first time I had the roasted galic & mozzarella chicken sausage with a side of chili cheese tater tots.  This time I went for the Habanero chicken sausage and the Bratwurst.  Of all I tasted I must say the Habanero!
a little bit of heat, but very flavorful.  

The service is great. both the chef and waitress always come by and check if everything is ok or if I need anything.

Awesome food and service, my son had the boss dog said it was amazing, I had the Rueben also 5 stars
The only downfall was the water tasted like plastic I don't know why and it won't stop me from going back just don't drink the water
Thumbs up! Great service, great food and very reasonably priced! Definitely worth the drive!
Amazing! Everytime we come here to eat it's always delicious!!! Thanks Jeff for making yummy dogs! Great service from Julian!

The people were really nice and the food was pretty good. I got a chicago dog and a cheeseburger. The chicago dog was decent, I'd order it again. I heard they won an award for their burger, so I might be in the minority here, but the burger patty reminded me of those perfect circle frozen patties you might buy at the grocery store. Not really fresh and juicy like some of the award winning burgers I've had elsewhere. My friend got a polish sausage and said it was really good. 

I'll be back to try out some more of the menu and hopefully give em a higher rating after.

Great Links is the only place I've found in Las Vegas that has both a vegetarian hot dog AND vegetarian chili, enabling me to have a veggie chili dog. Plus, the atmosphere is unique and the staff are helpful. We recently made the twenty minute drive there craving what only they offer. When we arrived, there was a sign on the door saying they were closed for a private party. We called from the parking lot, and they made our food and brought it to our car with many apologies and some free Oreos. :)

This is a great little spot. I have been going to for years. Another little mom and pop spot, and those are my favorite.

They have a great variety of dogs, burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers to choose from. Although I haven;t tried it all (gimmie some time) everything I have tried has been great. When you're all done get a shake or a float to top it off..hell ya.

This is a small place so word of advice if you go during peak times, plan for a wait or you can also order and eat in the patio that sits a couple of stores down.

Decided to go to this place because I tried a different restaurant and the food was horrible. So I came here and finally got some great food. The staff was amazing and the restaurant was clean definitely will come here again
Best Vegetarian/Vegan  Food in Vegas !!! Vegetarian Cheese Steak , Chicken Nuggets , Bacon , Hot Dogs , Bratwurst  , Chili , Burgers , Italian Sausage and more !!!! Bomb.com

Ok, I've seriously died and went to Artery Clogging Heaven!  This place is Awesome!

Among other things, I really enjoy Burgers & Hot Dogs....and this place has plenty of it!  There were so many things on the menu, I didn't know where to start.....

So, I went with a Pastrami Cheeseburger (Pastrami, Grilled Onions, Provolone, & Mustard on a Burger)....and a Regular Hot Dog.

Since I was dining solo, I sat at the counter behind the Grill.  I waited patiently and watched the short order cook prepare the artery choking goodness for all the patrons and myself.....that was fun.

After about 10 minutes my order was up.  I went after the Pastrami Cheeseburger first.....wow, it was tasty.  I liked the proportion of Pastrami to Cheeseburger.....some places put too much Pastrami and it overwhelms the burger....not here.  I also liked how well the Grilled Onions tasted.....they were chopped in med sized pieces which I prefer to the larger sized ones you find in some places.  It was so good, I didn't add anything to it....I ate it as it was served.

Next, I added some Mustard to the Regular Dog and bit into it.  I felt a familiar ~Snap~ as I took that first bite.....awesome!  You don't find too many snapper dogs around town, so I was pleased that I did.  Every bite was full of Hot Dog goodness.

There are so many varieties of Dogs & Burgers here, not to mention side dishes that I want to try.

Will I return?  I guarantee you I'll be back at least 10 times to try other stuff on the menu.
Great Chicago dog and chili cheese dog. Staff is very friendly. A cool place that we look forward to visiting again.

Today was my first time in this great little spot! I loved the laid back atmosphere and the burger was probably the best I've had in Vegas! I decided on just a regular burger with everything on it and chedar cheese fries and the whole table ended up eating my fries. Highly recommended!
I had the grilled Ortega pepper bacon cheeseburger. It was delicious. Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The service was friendly and prompt. I will return.

My friend took me here to great links. I ordered the old west burger and sweet potato French fries. Both were excellent and delicious. My friend ordered the Italian beef sandwich and a New York hot dog. He said they were awesome. The Owner is very friendly and greets many of his customers including us.(like the Mayor)

Decided to try this place because of the great reviews, but I really did not enjoy it.

- The waitress didn't know the menu, told us the Italian beef had cheese and It did not. 
- All the tables had empty ketchup bottles that was annoying
- it took almost 40 minutes to get our food, it was 4 sandwiches and fries. 
- The Italian beefs sandwiches were bland as hell, from reading the past reviews it seems this place is falling behind. 

Would not come back

Side note - group of 4 came in @ 6pm

This place was amazing! Service was great and the food even better !! It was our first time but it is our new favorite. It has the small intimate family owned feel and the meat is top quality. The food combined with the great service left us very impressed
Love this Place! The Quality of the Food and prices are awesome! Love the Chicago all beef hot dog and the burgers are amazing compared to prices at Five Guys.

I really, really, really wanted a hotdog, after googling a few local places, my hunny brought me here. The selection was awesome and since everything is a la carte, you aren't locked into a combo meal you don't really want. We shared a small shoestring fry and each got two dogs, a plain and a specialty. 

The hotdogs themselves are great, they pop in your mouth, are juicy and full of flavor. I chose the deluxe chili dog which is basically a standard chili dog plus bacon, onion, jalape√±os and a literal fistful of shredded cheese. I'm super picky about chili, can't stand it if it's soupy or greasy or overly spicy for no reason. I wasn't disappointed, everything about it was delicous. My hunny picked the Las Vegas chili dog, and I can honestly say, it was basically a flavor explosion on a bun. 

My order was misread and delivered wrong at first, but the cook not only insisted on fixing it, did so in record time. The server was nothing but helpful, the overall service was great.  If the order had come out correctly the first time, this would be a solid five star review, as it is, I'd honestly say it's more of a 4.5 than a 4. If want a hotdog but wanna have it be better than pretty much anything you could make at home for a reasonable price, this is your place. 

I can't even wait to try the sausage selection.

This place was amazing.  When the kids and adults enjoy it, it's a win win.  Staff gave kids paper and crayons to play with before food came.  When food came the kids ate it and loved it!  My husband and I enjoyed our hotdogs, fried mushrooms, master grill fries, and fresh brewed root beers.  The staff even gave the kids their own pack of Oreo cookies free.  Whenever I'm in need of a hotdog this is the place I will be coming.

Wow!  That's a good looking dog. 

Small little joint but very friendly and fast service.  

Had:  Chicago Dog, tator tots (not enough places serve tator tots), Beer brat with kraut and hot peppers......AND draft root beer.  All were good.  (The presentation of my Chicago dog was quiet lovely--pic to follow.  I didn't want to disturb it's artful slumber but whateva, I was hungry.)

They actually have a large selection of dogs (meat and vegetarian dogs).  We'll be back to try some more.  It definitely had a very cool atmosphere too.  One tv played sports and another was on a "gadgets/technology" channel. The staff was just...cool.

Almost forgot, they serve beer too.
There is a reason that Great Links won the burger wars competition.  This place is amazing.  I love when a small business like this can beat out the competition of a major chain.

Not one of the best hot links I have had. A lot closer to the worst. Sat at the counter and watched the cook do his thing and the things he did were not what I would considered the best practices for a good hot dog. What would the technique matter as long as the result was tasty. While I was watching the cook I had memories of Chef Randy and Robert Irvine going into a restaurant and chastising cooks for not having a clean grill and covering everything with a pan when it was cooking. Mind you as long as the end result was a culinary masterpiece I am a big fan of a good, tasty sandwich I was open and excited looking forward to tasting a fantastic dog  on a toasted bun with raw onions, relish, and brown and yellow mustard. A basic sandwich hard to do wrong. But the end result was so wrong. The taste of the meat and bun was lost somewhere between the cooked onions, peppers, burgers and whatever else was cooked on the grill.  The place had a good sized crowd was real busy and the people seemed to be enjoying the food. But this is one customer that will not be  regular or even occasional patron.

I'd NEVER been to a place specialising in hot dogs and wouldn't even think to order a hamburger! My sister saw them win Burger Wars and insisted we try their food. I live in the area and easily ordered my dinner on the phone after reviewing their menu online. I showed up 10 minutes later and was given a free small beverage. Because of the weight, I assumed I'd be dealing with a mess when I got home and amazingly enough everything was wrapped perfectly! We ordered the Ortega Bacon Pepper Jack Burger, the Old West Burger and the award winning Jalapeno Guacamole Cheeseburger. WOW! For the same price as In-N-Out or Five Guys, we had seriously delicious gourmet burger's. We will be back to try everything else on the menu and tell everyone we know about it!

This place is awesome. My boyfriend and I are both vegan and saw this place come up on HappyCow. They have veggie meats that can be substituted (at no additional cost) on any of their menu items. The only veg options that aren't vegan is the veg bacon and veg hot dog. Great place to eat if you want to venture of the strip! 

Vegetarian selections:
Veggie hot dog
Veggie Italian sausage
Veggie beer brat
Veggie kielbasa 
Veggie chicken patty
Veggie burger patty
Veggie bacon
Veggie chili

Good food, small place. They have a nice selection of dogs, sausages, and burgers as well as multiple versions of French fries. I enjoyed my beer brat served mob boss style, which included mushrooms, grilled onions and peppers, marinara sauce, and two mozzarella sucks. The Italian fries were okay - heavy on the Parmesan cheese, light on the garlic butter sauce and Italian seasonings. I had a taste of my boyfriends Italian beef sandwich and it was the best of the bunch with a decent portion of beef, grilled peppers, and a nicely flavored au jus for dipping. Definitely worth going back!

Excellent Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich.  Cheesy, meaty, lots of onions and peppers.  I would not change a thing.  Fish Sandwich is big and fresh.  Friendly quick service.  Next time I go back I will probably just order the same thing again.

I really wish I would have liked this place more, especially because I was super excited to finally try it. Actually, when I first walked in, I kind of fell in love. The atmosphere is relaxed and our server was super friendly, gave us time and answered any questions we had. 

We ordered the Chicago and the Las Vegas hot dog with the natural Italian fries on the side. The fries came out first and unfortunately they were just ok. Too much parmesan cheese, too salty and too fatty and they got soggy very quick. The hot dogs were ok, almost too much of everything in my opinion. 

Then, as soon as we walked out of this place, I ended up having an upset stomach that lasted all day. But this also could be due to me eating generally organic and healthy and perhaps my body doesn't like fatty food anymore. My husband was ok and he ate the same as I did, so I don't think the meat was bad. Regardless, I didn't like it enough to go back any time soon, but if I did, I think I would stay away from all the loaded hot dogs and try a simple one or get a sandwich.

I went here during the lunch rush on a Friday and this place was packed.  I was able to grab a table right away because the gal was quick to keep them bussed.  I ordered a number two thinking the dogs would be small like a Nathan's dog or something you could get at a grocery store.  I was wrong, they are big enough to need their own basket.  Luckily I was able to talk my husband into eating the second one for me.  Even though the place was busy, we were checked on four times.  I walked out the door stuffed and the bill, less than 20 bucks.  I will be back.

Love the food here!! My favorite locals stop. I would be remiss if I didn't mention our server Michelle, she is a HUGE reason why we come back time after time. Her friendly attitude and her "make you feel like home" ways truly make the dining experience. 
You're lucky to have such a great employee who seems to love what she does and her guests!!

The food was made to order, nice and hot when I got it. Despite my food being loaded w great dressings it still looked nice and tastes even better. The staff was very courteous and extremely helpful when telling me about the menu. Awesome place to eat at!

Service was phenomenal ! The staff check on us periodically but not to the point where it was annoying. Their food is amazingly good! It has a very authentic taste, I love their cheese sticks they are out of this world good ! I had a hotdog with a spicy link New York style and it did not disappoint. Great place to come eat! And great staff.

I am loving this place.  Very friendly helpful staff.  Met the owner so it's family owned and operated.  Fun atmosphere.  The menu is extensive. We were craving a good hotdog. This is centrally located to us so we will definitely be back soon.  My husband loved his vegas dog and I'm happy with my simple dill dog.

Yum, yum, yummy!  I'm in love with Great Links!

We finally made it over to Great Links this weekend and I am kicking myself for making it out here sooner!  I have wasted many, many years of AMAZING edible delights by not coming to Great Links earlier.  At least I have seen the light and the error of my ways!

We sampled the Streets of New York Dog (yum), the Ball Park Dog (classic), and a kraut dog (tasty), as well as the √ºber-fantastic Italian tater tots.  The dogs were all amazing!  The have a great snap when you bite in to them, which is always a sign of a quality dog.  The toppings were all on point and in a decent amount for the dogs we ordered.  I think the kraut here is some of the best I have ever had.  EVER.  

Now on to the the most fabulous tater tots I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  We tried the Italian tater tots on our server's recommendation.  We were going to do fries, but her told us the tater tots would stand up better to all of the sauce, so we went with it.  Oh my goodness, those things were tasty!  The garlic goodness was great and the Parmesan on top sent it over the moon.  We had them finished before I had finished my hot dog, so I used some of my bun to soak up the extra sauce and it was stay fantastic.  Yummmm!

I can't wait to go back and try more dogs, sausages, burgers, and everything else they had on the huge menu.  I see this place becoming a very regular place for my family.

I had heard of this place a long time ago and forgot about it by the time I moved to the area.  I saw it recently while driving around and thought "gee, I gotta get me some of that."  So come Saturday I was really craving a hot dog and off I went to be wrapped up in the menu like a hot dog in a bun.  It is a big menu for such a small place.  There are many different varieties of hot dogs as one might expect from a place called Great Links Hot Dogs.  But there is so much more.  There are also many types of sausage sandwiches to choose from as well.  Did I forget to mention they are famous for their burgers.  Yeah, they have won the Burger Wars burger competition two years running.  Then there are the many diffferent fried potato variations and combinations too.  Onion rings, jalapeno poppers, fried mushrooms.  The menu goes on and on.  I was so fascinated in all the offerings they have that I forgot all about my hot dog craving and went with a sausage sandwich instead.  It was a toss up between the Roasted Garlic and Mozzarela or the Spinach and Asiago Cheese.  The Spinach and Asiago is topped with mustard, mayo, tomato, pickles, relish and sport peppers not unlike a Chicago style hot dog.  It sounded damn good as a Chicago style dog is my favorite.  In the end it was the Roasted Garlic and Mushroom sausage that won my stomach and my heart.  A perfectly grilled chicken sausage stuffed with cheese and mushrooms then topped with grilled onion, bell peppers and mushrooms with the addition on marinara on top of that.
