I also got an order of the stuffed jalapenos.  There were six in a basket and were served piping hot fresh out of the fryer.  The crisp coating was not oily despite being fried for about 4 minutes.  The molten cream cheese inside was nearly too much for my mouth to handle but the cooling richness of the ranch dip helped everything slide down.  Add a 22 ounce Amber Bock beer and Saturday is now the happiest day of the week.

Came here tonight w my husband. I couldn't eat anything there because of how disgusted I was with some serious hygiene concerns:

1. Started off with a dirty chair - crumbs and drips of liquid- no big deal, I understand. I asked the waitress wipe it down which she happily did, yet for the fact she only wiped down half if the chair..... Oh well I am hungry, I will sit in the still wet chair with unknown liquid....

2. Saw the cook with his gloves on wipe his nose with his gloves. Like a strong finger length swipe of the nostril.  He didn't change his gloves after that. His gloves were also clearly moistened so you can tell that his hands were sweating under the gloves which makes me wonder, how long have those gloves been on? 

3. Next a different cook comes out into the dining room with gloves on again- gets himself a drink of water. I can clearly can see water drips through them. He then takes a napkin to his nose and wipes- does not change gloves. Then this guy tries to take our order, same gloves - pointing at the menu what are the featured items, giving me a closer view of the gloves to confirm, yes your hands are sweating bullets under these gloves which appear to have been on for at least 3 hours...  This guy was really nice and the food sounded awesome but the more and more I had to witness this weird Glove phenomenon.... I couldn't even order. Who wears gloves in the dining room of a restaurant????

My husband got his food to go, but I am pregnant and after viewing everyone w gloves on and wiping noses, getting personal drinks, taking orders, even flipping through a magazine, and then apparently not changing gloves - too much for me to risk a food borne illness or any other germ.

Really sucks the menu looked great too. Everyone was nice, it was just so awkward and the most disturbing thing is that these folks seemed to act like it was no big deal to not change gloves, which makes me wonder goes on behind the scenes in terms of cleanliness.

Sorry for the negative review but just had to share this and hopefully management will use this to improve.
This place is great, they really listen to their customers. So many customers mentioned wanting vegan mayo, so they now have vegan mayo! I am so excited!!

Holy smokes the dog I got was delicious! Think it's called the 9th island luau special. It was topped w/ BBQ pulled pork, mozzarella, potato hash, and a mango salsa! Service was friendly (I just ordered to go but I was greeted quickly, order taken and food made quickly to order). Best hot dog I've had. They've got about 20+ choices, plus a bar, and other sandwiches/ drinks/ sides, even soup and salads. I'll definitely be back to try other things. Awesome little neighborhood spot, next to my favorite nail place and Starbucks. What else do u need lol?!

I was disappointed in the service within moments of walking in the door. However, I was still excited to try the food. 

There were three guys preparing the food, and one woman who ran the register as well as the entire floor. She greeted us by asking if our order was for there or to go. Since we said 'to go', she said that she would help us in a moment. She then proceeded to take an order at one table, ring up another table, and check on one more table before returning to take our order. 
Okay, this was fine. Sort of. What ruined the visit for me was how she chewed her gum, open-mouth and all, while took our order. She didn't look at us, and didn't say anything when she presented us with our receipt to sign. No enthusiasm or care for anything, especially our business. That makes me angry. 

We both got the 'Chicago Dog'. Since the dogs are made with Boar's Head meat, they did have pretty good flavor. However, maybe we should have chosen something other than a Chicago dog, as nothing compares to the real thing. 

Would I go back again?...possibly. Chicago Dog?...nope. To-go?...yes, if I called my order in ahead of time.
This place has the best hot dogs in town! The Las Vegas Chili dog and fries are a must!! And please don't forget the draft root beer...one word... DELICIOUS!!
Great place and great Hot Dogs and Sausages. We stopped in and I had the Chicago and Wifey had the Garlic Sausage with Chili/Cheese. Both were fantastic. Highly recommend.
Awesome service and food every single visit we have eaten here. No better place to grab a hotdog or burger with your family in the North, northwest and their jalapeno poppers are everything.

If you are craving greasy/oily, sloppy, fatty food come here! lol My bf loves this place and its actually good, I just feel bad coming here since I'm always trying to keep count of calories. Anyways, they have a huge menu with a lot to choose from.  Not pricey at all with decent size portions. 
KUDOS to the older man that was working his butt off in the kitchen last Saturday morning, when it got super busy.

I sat while the blonde girl at the register socialized.
Somebody waved her down for a check, she did that...back to talking. Would have loved to try the food, but they don't seem to value customers.

We had an excellent meal in this unassuming restaurant. What drew is here was the fact that they have vegetarian substitutes for every menu item, so both my husband and I can eat off the menu. I had the vegetarian slaw dog with chili. It was delicious! My husband had the Chicago dog which he enjoyed. We shared the Italian fries which we agreed would be a reason alone to return! The service was quick and friendly. We'll be back for sure!

I like their dogs,  best ones in town.   Customer service usually sucks though because the staff gets so bitchy.  

Today my experience here was worse than in the past.   They had the basketball game so loud that it was hard to be heard by the cashier when ordering (TV is right above the ordering station for to go orders).   After waiting for several minutes to be acknowledged by the staff someone came to the register.   The order taking guy didn't look at me once during the order and I had the distinct feeling I was keeping him from his tables. I tried to order what I used to get (was called the Great Linkisi or some such) and instead of telling me "we don't make that anymore" the order taker simply denied all knowledge of the old flagship dog and didn't offer similar options even when asked.   He was not even willing to check with another staff member to see if they knew what it was (and a lot of these guys have worked here for a while).

My hubby had a craving to come here. He'd eaten there but I'd never been before so I decided to give it a try. We had to wait a while for our food because the place was so busy. I ordered a pastrami sandwich, garlic parm fries AND a chili dog (for later). We placed our order to go.

Upon getting home and opening the bag, everything looked really appetizing. I planned to eat the chili dog and fries for lunch and save the pastrami sandwich for dinner.  after two bites of the chili dog.....I was like no. Its hard for me to put into words how it tasted to me. Almost chemical like someone dipped it into a cleaning solution.  I tried another bite when common sense set in and my only thought was, "your body is trying to tell you something, don't eat it". I don't know if maybe I'm allergic to something in the meat but I had an aversion to it. The fries were very tasty but swimming in oil. That was the bulk of my meal for that sitting.

The pastrami sandwich was alright. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there for it. I did manage to finish it though.
I have eaten here many times.  The food is always fresh, hot & yummy.  Prices are pretty average.  You do get large portions too.  I recommend to anyone looking for some great gut bomb food.

Devoted to get some lunch from here based on coworkers feed back and I'm so glad I did! I had a Rueben and green beans fries and both were delish! The Rueben is made with rye bread and was super juicy. Green beans are battered and fried, they come with wasabi ranch dipping sauce and are recommended by staff. I highly enjoyed my lunch and will be coming back to try other things off the menu. This joint has 5 star potential, thus far.

So as many of my yelpers know I'm a very dedicated foodie and today I stumbled upon the holy grail a place that took me back to the streets in New York while actually in Vegas. First of all I see a lot of good service in Vegas tend to be products of people from different places just being themselves but if you want the best service hands down you're gonna come to Great Links its the family you never knew you had. I promise you with Lisa on you'll never have an empty drink she's gonna come and make sure everything is 5 star and she's gonna laugh and have fun with you. But the king of the crop Mike the head cook. the grill master, the guy you want to cook at every barbecue you have for the rest of your life will find away to make the best of the best of whatever you want while many Maintaining great conversation. I know this will be a new weekly spot and its one of the only places we you can come and watch the news and have really educated conversation. All in all this is the best place in Vegas and all of everyone I know should come in
Found this little gem via Yelp. Hankering for a Chicago dog. Small restaurant, diverse selection and yummy food!!  Try the root beer on draft too!

Yum!!! Great place if you want to be a fatty! The western chicken sandwich is my favorite and the grill master fries are like in & out animal style fries but better because you get to choose what fries you want. The fried mushrooms are really good too.

Ok first time here & ordered 3 Chicago Dogs, a bratwurst, a Pastrami with Swiss cheese & Mushrooms no onions or mustard, an order of fried Mushrooms & a order of fries. Chicago dogs were ok nothing special but not bad. The bratwurst came with no onions or mustard even though we asked for it. The Pastrami came with onions & Mustard & no Mushrooms. The fried Mushrooms the batter on the inside is still raw & Mushrooms are cold. Overall a big disappointment.

Great link's is my go to for comfort food in Vegas, but unfortunately I live in Henderson so I can't make it here as much as I'd like to, but when I do I always have a tough time choosing what I really want to eat cause they have a wide variety of choices from hot dogs, sausages, pastrami, cheese steaks amongst other delicious choices.
If you are ever in the neighborhood definitely make your way to Great Link's for their wonderful food and cheers like atmosphere everyone who works here is so down to earth it adds that extra something to the experience!

Wow, so glad we decided to drop in here!

Casual atmosphere, the servers were all super friendly, not pushy, and they make recommendations if you need one!

The food was really good.  We had a pastrami sandwich and an Italian beef sandwich and split them.  We also had the Vegas chili cheese fries and onion rings (it was a cheat day, no calorie counting!).  The Italian beef was ok (I really like the one from Rosati's on Losee), the pastrami really hit the spot and the Vegas chili is so yummy!!!

It was almost a fast-food/sports bar environment; there were a few TVs in case you don't care for your dining partner's conversation but it was kid-friendly.  I think they do serve beer if you're dining in.  

Also, they offer a military discount.

Get out there and support this business!

Love love love how they have vegetarian options for just about everything on the menu! Not to mention great tasting vegetarian options, to those familiar(or not) meat substitutes can be questionable. And the service and vibe in there has to be the reason we are always in there. They're so friendly and treat you like one of their friends or family!

First, if you're staying in a strip hotel, Great Links is a pretty good ride depending on traffic (which was deadly today!)...But, worth it. 

I visited Great Links this afternoon.  Excellent.  Great diner atmosphere, exceptionally friendly and quick service along with tasty food.  

I sampled the Mob Boss dog and the Original hot dog.  WOW!  

First I tried the original hot dog.  It was a traditional natural casing dog with onions, relish, mustard and catsup.  Great taste, good snap to the dog and nice flavor.

Then, I manned up and tried the Mob Boss which  has grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms, cheese sticks, and marina sauce.  Great flavor, good snap to the dog and enormous.  Truly, a meal on a bun.

Stop in here while you're visiting Vegas.  It is worth the trip off the strip.
Honestly, one of the best burgers I have had in a long time! Better than anything I've had at Bobby Flay's place, "Bobby's Burger Palace". Very good quality and cooked perfectly.
Love it! their chili cheese hot dog is delicious and their prices are very reasonable. The kids menu offers good variety and it even comes with oreo cookies for the little ones.

You know a hot dog is amazing when every single bite has that great crisp as you bite into the casing and at Great Links, you get that in every bite. But it's not just an amazing hot dog restaurant. There are tons of things on the menu from hamburgers to polish sausages to fries and philly cheese. Don't forget to try the fried pickle spears! They even have a selection of beers on tap to go with that Chicago dog complete with bright green relish.

The only reason I give the spot four stars is because of the size. They definitely need to expand but wasn't too busy when we stopped in.

They even have breakfast on the weekends although I haven't tried. Definitely recommend this spot for a great lunch!

I had this whole review written here about how great this place is and how you should get this and that and the other thing, but Yelp ate it and I'm spent.

So, go eat here. They're awesome. Great staff. Good food. 10% off your order when you get an entree, side and drink. Sigh.

I was looking forward to this hot dog, and sorry Great Links, but it was pretty average....... nothing great here........
I guess they used to use Boars Head Hot Dogs, but they are no longer able to get them from their supplier. The hot dogs they get now are okay, but an all beef hot dog, not the beef and sausage blend like the Boars Head brand.
I got the deluxe chili cheese hot dog and the deluxe chili cheese fries. The fry was the star of the show here, not the hot dog.
Still, all in all the place is nice, the service is nice, just a little disappointed in the "Great Link" I was hoping for.

I just got back from Vegas and my good friend had taken me and my wife there on the way to our hotel. I had no clue what this place was but it was really cool. They have a lot more than hot dogs. The beer was cheap, the dogs were good and the desserts were not bad either. I had a Boston Dog and it was better than I thought it would be. Its a small place so good luck finding a place to sit on the weekend. This place was good enough for us to go back before we had to go to the airport to come home.

Peace Out 
MZ
WOW. Get the Buffalo Fries and add the Vegas Chili, thank me later, as your life will now be changed forever. Your Welcome in advance.

OMG! This place rocks, food is fantastic and the staff are cool as hell! Carissa is the bomb made this experience totally enjoyable! Best fried pickles I've had in years! Overall experience 10+ You gotta try this spot and they serve beer bonus!

Hospitality is top notch as usual. As for the menu, it is more than great dogs.  Ask your server for suggestions if you are stuck or don't see exactly what you want. I usually get soup to complete my meal. They are super helpful in concocting exactly what you want. Also can order ahead if you are in a hurry!

Delicious! I have been here several times and tried both burgers and dogs they offer. My favorite thus far is their Vegas Chili Dog. It is smothered in their white sage chili which is unique and delicious! They offer many varieties of beer and a delicious root beer float to settle that sweet tooth. Staff is delightful and it's a fun casual environment.

Once again in Vegas hunting down great gluten and dairy free food with good taste.  We came to Great Links looking for their organic salad, but they were out.  It turned out awesome though.  Most of their sausages and hot dogs are gf!  And they were happy to make a grilled chicken sandwich protein-style for my friend.  My polish sausage was beautifully presented.  The French fries were yummy and the homemade fry sauce was plentiful and quite excellent!  Really loved the root beer on draft.  (It took me back to my Midwest days.) Michelle was super cool and took wonderful care of us.  Everyone there was really friendly.  We'll definitely come back.

Later note... Something had gluten unfortunately.  I think it was either the butter alternate used to grill the onions or the special fry sauce (malt vinegar?).  Ask if you are super sensitive.  They are really nice.

We love having breakfast here. Great food. Good people. If you're looking for a burger/dog joint. This is it. They allow you to make whatever your heart desires. Everything is a la carte, which is fine, you can mix and match. Prices are great for the quality of food.  Owner is a very humble guy. Unless you asked, you would not know that he is who he is.

With a strong hankering for a different kind of hot dog I was surprised to find a specialty eatery close to my side of town. As I entered I was greeted by one of the staff and was immediately consumed with the aroma of what I came for. The establishment is very clean and you have your choice of sitting at the counter or a table which seat either two or 4 patrons. Mind you, it's not a large business but they do well with the space they have. 
The menu is very descriptive that answers all your questions as to "what's in it"
Expect to wait for your order as they take meticulous pride in creating your dog. 
I ordered the Chicago Dog and some tator tots that rocked. Cooked to crunchy perfection and I couldn't stop popping them in my mouth. loved em. Exactly what I was craving. As I gobbled it down like my friends pet Shepherd my first thought was this is great hangover food. So I ordered a different dog because when your hungover you can't just eat one. Lol

Tried the chili cheese fries .. really good.
Staff is very quick and attentive. . Food is great. MUST TRY IF YOUR IN VEGAS

I've been here a few times and this is my favorite place to get hot dogs in town. Great Links makes fantastic dogs, sausages and burgers, and everything is fresh and made to order.

One of my favorite things here is their green sage chili. There is nothing else quite like it and you just need to try it if you come here. It comes on their Vegas Dog, Vegas Burger or Vegas fries, and I always get one of these every time I come here. I've also had their normal chili, and it's very good to if you don't want to try something new, but it isn't unique like the sage chili is.

One awesome thing is that they will make any of their sausages the same way they will make any of their specialty dogs. The last time we were here my wife got the Kielbasa (the largest sausage) prepared like the Philly dog. It was smothered in sauteed onions, peppers and cheese on a special roll that has been lightly toasted. It was amazing and huge.

The hot links are also very good and this is a great place to grab a juicy burger. The only downside here, to me, is that their "brewhouse" in their name is a little misleading. They have just a few draft lines and some bottled beer, but nowhere near the selection as the name infers.

All in all this is just a killer place to go for big lunch or dinner. If hot dogs, burgers and sausages with lots of great toppings are your thing, check this place out.

Awesome sausage dogs and hamburgers. Today we tried the Italian fries, BOMB! My son had the sage chili on his dog. After several times of trying it I have finally decided that I do not like the sage chili. It is to aromatic strong and tasting. Cool idea though.

Ooohh I love their burgers here--Specifically I've tried the Ortega Bacon Pepper jack Burger and Jalapeno Guacamole Burger. They have never disappointed me. 

Try them all. Actually really anything here is good.--next time I'll go for the hot dogs

Every time I come here I experience great service and get great food.  The staff is awesome and I have liked everything I have ever eaten here.  Thank you Mike for the Shock Top Beer Brat, that was awesome.  This star bump was long overdue from me.

Arrive at 7:00p, get greeted 10 minutes after and server apologizes for wait.... Said he will be back with us shortly 8 minutes pass and he finally gets out order. Made to order so it's fresh.  Hot dog and Philly cheesesteaks were pretty good.  Would come back and try again because customer service was so good.

I've eaten here several times and have always had a dog or a brat and have never been disappointed. I love to sit at the bar and watch the grill team work. They are in perfect synch...one guy on the grill, another on fries and a third expediting. And the taste is dynamite. They range from classic combinations to interesting. They also have burgers and boast of being top rated in Vegas by Fox News. So, I had one. It was good, but not great. The burgers alone wouldn't bring me back....but the Dogs...Heck Yes!

Great hot dogs and burgers I love the Chicago dog. Its easier to do take out instead of eating there. The restaurant is small and the day I went only had one waitress to service every one. The waitress was very nice and helpful.

First off great customer service. This is a small establishment with a lot to offer. Their focus is hot dogs and beer, but they also offer sausages, hamburgers and hot sandwiches. We enjoyed the Chicago dog, Parmesan French fries and the Italian beef hot sandwich which were all excellent. Worth mentioning was the homemade raspberry tea and the 10% military discount. 

I will absolutely be returning here for lunch!

Most places with veg options = side salad, fries, &/or veggie burger....but not this place!

You have the options of 4 diff veggie hot dogs, burgers, bacon, and chili. I love being able to grab American classics on the go. Normally I would have to make these at home but Brewhouse allows the comfort of convenience with their array of veggie friendly options.
Food is Soooo good. They treat you like family even when its busy. Love love love everything about this place.  It's like a hidden Gem

The food is worth 4 stars, service is worth 2. 

I've been a couple of times recently and they are consistently understaffed...which leads to long wait times to place or pick up a to-go order, and slow service when you dine in. Their main waitress seems too busy and stressed, and the owner really needs to bring on another person during the lunch rush or else risk losing business. 

As for the food- the Italian fries are so good! Make sure to get them with the skinny fries (the crinkle fries are too fat and never really seem crispy), and their fry sauce. My husband loved his Las Vegas Chili Dog, and they do a great Chicago Dog. If they give their staff some help and bring on another server we'd be back more often.

I was lucky enough to check this place out when I was in the area for a doctors appointment. Wow! Talk about tasty artery clogging food! Leave your calorie and carb counting at the door this place is worth it!

They use Boars Head brand hot dogs. They are the perfect start to all their hot dogs and they have tons of them anyway you can think of. They also have tons if burgers and fry options. It was very hard to pick what we wanted because everything sounded good!! We both choose the Philly dog with cheese sauce. Joel ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger. Of course we had to pick cheese fries and onion rings. I ordered a whole dill pickle, but they were out. They were super apologetic about it and instead gave me pickle spears for free! The food was excellent and messy! Be prepared to use ALL the napkins! The hot dogs had a snap to them and could totally be eaten with a fork and knife. The fries were crisp as were the onion rings. Great Links even offers fry sauce. Joel's burger was also tasty and moist. Perfectly cooked too! ( It's hard to get a perfect medium burger sometimes.) We both left so full. 

I wish they were closer to us, but Great Links is totally worth the drive. If you have the serious munchies this is your spot! Their menu is huge and reasonably priced. Plus they have cheese sauce!!! You can't go wrong with that!!!

Service is inviting and kind.

The food... forget the strip, forget Gordon Ramsey- this is the best burger and sandwiches my friends and I have ever had. 

The prices are fantastic and underpriced for the quality.

new favorite right here, thank you guys so much!
This was a fun find! Excellent food and yummy fries.  A little small (space-wise), but the food more than made up for it. The service was attentive and they kept our cups full! A definite repeater.

Alright so I've been here quite a few times and so far I think to stick with the hot dog, links/sausages offerings and sides. After delving off menu a few times, I think it's the most solid they have to offer. 

My  favorites out of the hot dog is the Las Vegas chili dog or chicago dogs. I also often get the sausages, mostly hot links. Hot dogs are Boars head so they have natural casings or you can get other types without the snap, even a white hot dog/veal one. Sides wise their fried green beans with wasabi mayo is really good. To drink get Sprechers root beer off the tap! Also their raspberry ice tea isn't that regular Lipton soda fountain stuff, it's brewed so that is good too. 

Stick with that and I think you'll have a good dinner here. Cheap, good American type food.

Seeing as they won some "best of" burgers,  thought their burgers would be fantastic, but it isn't any different from any old greasy spoon. Also fish type stuff, is pre battered so not anything you can't do at home with some Gordon's. I feel like some stuff is offered, just to offer it. I thought the turkey burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches and tuna melt were decent though. 

My one thing about this place is that do not come at peak hours. I don't know if the owner is too cheap to hire another person but they really need more than one waitress, there's never been two waitresses I've ever seen. We went recently where it hit max capacity in this small place and she was in the weeds the whole time. It was hard to flag her down for some extra sauce, I had to wait a long time by the cash register, I just got up to serve ourselves some drinks (good thing I did not get raspberry tea that was behind the register). She already is running around like mad even when it's not a full house so they really need two people at least during the rush. It's not fair to the poor gal or to customers. I know it's not her fault, but some people were upset...and it sucks if she gets crapped on for something she cannot control at all. I'm going to stick with going only in the odd hours. I don't like going to a place and get no service. 

Overall though, I like this place.

The food in this place is ridiculous! Ridiculously delicious! Our server/waiter/host/comedian was really nice! Extra nice to the kids! Made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed...im talking about you Charlie...lol
When the food came out we were shocked on how much toppings they put in between the bun..
You can probably order anything on the menu and will be satisfied. 
Definitely will came here again and again!
Best hot dogs and sausages in the city. Super friendly staff, great prices, and a good kids menu.

Vegas needs more places exactly like this! Not only do they make amazing assed hot dogs, they also have something called a pastrami cheeseburger (I CAN HAS?). Their menu is extensive and goes anywhere from a plain hot dog to full on Chicago dogs and Caesar salads.  For such a small place they had quite the selection of beers (by the bottle), too. 
    I went with the Chicago dog and was excited to see they use the bright green relish. I have never been to Chicago, but I feel even the most extreme purist would delight in this party in your mouth. The wiener (hehe) was crisp with every bite and the toppings were fresh! The service felt familiar and could be confused with anywhere but Vegas. I haven't even gotten to the best part... The Cottage fries. Made fresh with each order, they are fried to perfection and lightly seasoned with sea salt. No ketchup needed. I will go back just for these. I hear they are crowded on Sunday Mornings, next time I go I'll be sure to go for breakfast.

Love their hot dogs and tater tots. I can pass on their burgers although  they have won a few burger competitions. 
That sage chili tho! So freaking good! I can put that on almost anything and it will still be good. It's like crack! GET IT! IT'S A MUST! 
Seems like a friendly atmosphere to eat.  I usually to go orders  here. The workers a  nice. It does get busy and is a small place so I prefer to just  enjoy my  food at home.
Food is painfully good!! The Chicago dog and the Philly cheesesteak is hands down the best In town only wish they had cots to lay on after binging food coma
Some of the best food that I have had on this part of town. The food was phenomenal, and I can't wait to go here again. I would suggest ordering the patty melt on rye, or the cheesesteak.

Came here a long while back and gave the hot dogs a go (which were GOOD)...now I had a chance to try the burger!

Pastrami Cheeseburger ($8.29): 1/3lb, Pastrami, Provolone Cheese, Grilled Onions, and Spicy Mustard. Very good burger...very juicy and love the MELTED cheese! Lots of flavor in their pastrami as well...GREAT choice!

Also tried the Italian Beef Sandwich ($7.99): Simmered in Italian spiced Au Jus with Green Peppers. Not a huge fan of Italian beef sandwiches, but this was good overall.

And the fries :

Vegas Chili Cheese Fries ($6.59): Sage Sausage White Chili, Pepper Jack Cheese, Tomatoes, Cayenne Sour Cream, and Spicy Mustard. This was great, with lots of spices in the sausage/chili and sauces. A bit HEAVY on the mustard, but still enjoyable.  PORTION was too big, so I took the rest to work with me, and somehow they still tasted good HOURS later...what the??

Italian Fries ($3.99): Garlic Butter Sauce, Italian Seasonings, and Parmesan Cheese. These were very good! LOTS of garlic flavor...yum!  I had these last time I was here and knew we were gonna order them again this time!  I'd recommend these most outta the bunch :P

Service is fast and friendly here.  I need to stop in more often :)

Pics :

I know, I know...5 stars for hot dogs? But I love this place. It's easy, it's clean, the people that work there are happy and have a good time. AND there is nothing healthier than leaving the gym to have a hot dog and fries...so try their hot dogs!

I had high hopes for this place but was definitely disappointed. The natural cut fries were so soggy and definitely greasy. Added chili and it seeped through the paper. The only reason I finished them is because I was absolutely starving. My dad for a meatball sub, which looked average. I got a Chicago dog without a bun. It was wrinkly and looked like it had been sitting. I ordered my son a kids meal; hot dog with no bun. It came with a bun. He's allergic to gluten. His shoestring fries were better than ours (not greasy) and his hotdog looked better than mine too- bigger and sans wrinkles. The waitress was friendly though and even though it's a small venue, it's comfortable to be in. I may come back if we are in a pinch. It wasn't awful but it definitely was NOT good either.... Oh and did I mention our table was dirty too and it never got cleaned off? My dad actually had to remove a leftover plate. Kinda gross.

This place rocks.  Come for the fresh cut fries and stay for the pastrami topped cheese burger. . Everyone left full and happy. 

Don't forget to try the Italian fries.  That garlic butter is dangerously good.

This place rocks!  It's a burger and hot dog joint with tons of options. The service is always stellar and the food is delicious! They also have so many vegan and vegetarian options. The Italian fries are so good!

My family loves this place! The food is amazing but sometimes the service isn't! I would kind of expect the service to be not great with only 2-3 people working in the whole place...... but the food is worth it.  I love the Philly! I love the kids meal basket with like every single kid food in it (Corn dog, grilled cheese, tater tots, chicken fingers).  My husband loves pretty much everything there. The menu is large and there are tons of options. They never give me a hard time about customizing either.
I was surprised their food is really good and their bun the BUN will just melt in your mouth OMG

I'm up in arms that it's taken me so long to try out Great Links Brewhouse & Grill. I really have no excuse. It's close to home, has great Yelp reviews, and even has veggie dogs on the menu. Come to find out not only do they have offer veggie hot dogs, they have a full blown vegetarian faux meat menu that includes veggie chili, brats, cheese steak, bacon, and chicken nuggets! Veggie items are priced the same as their meaty counterparts. I squealed in excitement and vowed to be a regular customer if the food was good. Ladies and gents, I was not disappointed. 

DELUXE CHILI CHEESE DOG ($5.49): Covered in vegetarian chili, cheddar cheese, and jalapeno slices (sans onions). A few slices of veggie bacon were tucked in the veggie hot dog. Tasted awesome, and I'm so glad to have an eatery that really caters to the vegetarian community. I only wish the cheese was more melt-y. 4/5

LAS VEGAS CHILI DOG ($5.49): This dog comes with white chili and is an upgraded version to the traditional dog. Cayenne sour cream and pepper jack cheese were some of the unexpected ingredients. Husband liked it! 4/5

ITALIAN FRIES ($4.29): Loaded with parmesan cheese. Not what I'm used to but we were happy with these fries. 4/5

ZUCCHINI STYX ($4.99): These were just okay. Probably won't order them again. The zucchini was too squishy. 2/5

VIBE: Small, casual hot dog joint. 4/5

SERVICE: Upon walking in, we thought we were supposed to order at the counter but we were instructed to sit down at a table. Our waitress was super nice and checked in on us often. As we left the guys working behind the counter waved and bid us a friendly farewell. 4/5

GOOD TO KNOW: They have a BOGO coupon in the Entertainment Book, up to $6. 

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #240

I love how their hot dogs snap when you bite into them.  The hot links are equally delicious with the peppers, onions and mustard.  Oh...and the burgers are top notch too!  Don't miss the crinkle cut fries with hot sauce and gobs of melted cheddar cheese.  Lastly, you'll need a hand scooped shake to wash it all down.  This place is the true Heart Attack Grill.

OMG...Something for everyone and it is all wonderful. 
This is ONE place you must try (and then you will be hooked)
Meat or Veggie,,,, they got it for you

I feel so silly to think I've already done a review for Great Links! I've been here so many times since they opened...I was going to update my review but it turns out, there was nothing to update! FAIL!

They have good hotdogs here. They're fresh and you could hear the snap when you bite into one. I personally like to keep it simple and get the chili dog. Very flavorful and I don't like beans so this is perfect for me. The cheese is nice and melted. But I've also tried their Mob Boss Dog which has mozzarella sticks, peppers, onions, marinara, mushrooms and parmesan cheese.  It's a great hotdog when I'm not feeling so plain.

The main reason I like this place is their Italian fries. One of my favorite fries in Vegas. Each fry is loaded with Parmesan and Italian spices. I don't like sharing mine so get your own!

I remember John Curtas raving about their burgers but I still haven't deviated from their hotdogs.  One of these days, I'll give their burger a try...with a side of Italian fries of course!

I love this place ! Being vegetarian it's super difficult finding a place that my boyfriend and I can both enjoy. Especially when his favorite things to eat are hotdogs and hamburgers. The food was great, don't get me wrong it was greasy but just the way it should be! We can't wait to go back.
I love this place there food is amazing and people that are irk here are so nice I eat here with family when ever I can. If you are looking for a great Philly cheese steak come here ooo and cold beer

Yes this is an update...1st of all incredible array of hot dog offerings..if they don't have it listed, they will make the dog for you!! Decided to go in the burger direction this time.....Probably had the best Patty melt I've ever had. It was cooked to order, medium..nicley grilled onions and your choice of cheese. I can see why they won the burger wars...they deserve it. While i was waiting was offered a free small soda..It you want a great dog or burger make this a distination stop. Staff is very help ful they will assist you in every way to make your repast good.....Enjoy

I'm a woman who knows her way around a dog - both the male variety and the frankfurter type. Ok, no more man bashing! I like men, might even review them as a a group, However, decided not to resist the joke. So, no offense right? Plus, I'm about to tell you all about a great place. so forgive me, this one time.
Ok, locally owned, which I LOVE. Family has fought hard to keep the place going and has had some incredible challenges, including the wife's battle with cancer.  However, they remain committed to good food, good service, and good attitudes. I know they won a burger competition put on by Fox 5. Not much staff turnover which tells me a lot. They had a coupon in last year's Entertainment Book.  I haven't checked the new one.  Haven't seen them on Groupon or Living Social. I need to check Restaurants.com, Prices are fair without a coupon though and they have meal deals.
Before I forget, they offer some very interesting vegetarian options. I would order one to try it, but who am I kidding? I'm there for the dogs. Sometimes, I'm there for the clams. Sometimes, for the rueben, but never for the veggies. Wait, do breaded and fried mushrooms count?
Incredibly large menu, which I'm sure they do to please customers but must be hard to maintain. They even do breakfast.
My favorite is the Atlanta dog. Not to be a diva, but I special order mine and they always remember.  I like the dog in the natural casing.  They do the dog a little longer for me. They also take the cole slaw out of the fridge before they start the dog cause I don't want cold slaw to cool off the hot dog. Ok, feel free to groan. I swear I didn't mean the pun. I try to be a woman of integrity, so I'm going to leave it. 
I also like the red onion sauce - that might be the NY dog. Shame that I was born in NY and I'm not sure which is my dog.  Doesn't matter cause the dogs are described on the menu. :Plus you can order whatever you would like.
I'm not much of a fry girl, but you need to order them here.  They offer different kinds and great toppings.  They have beer, which I haven't had yet.  Well, I've had beer, just not at Great Links. They have ice cream and shakes, both of which I have had and enjoyed.
Great local place with quality junk food. I'm not sure it gets better than that.

Was all the way on the Northwest side of town to go play a poker game at my brother's, and somehow my friend and I ended up at Great Links.  Let's face it, Chili dogs, burgers and fries just go together with a night of drinking and poker.  I wasn't about to offer Sweet Tomatoes express as a suggestion for our pre-game snack.

Right when I walked in I noticed a big board on the counter detailing their win as the Best Burger in Las Vegas.  I remember seeing some stuff about this contest on Fox 5 and John Curtas was one of the guest judges, so I figured it had some clout behind it.  I asked the waitress about it because I wanted to order the EXACT burger that won, and she was actually very upfront about how the contest was set up, and that it did have exclusions (I don't believe my current favorite Bachi was able to be represented due to cost, same with Burger Bar)   Hmmmm, doubt already started setting in.   Turns out the burger that won that contest was the Jalapeno Guacamole burger, which turned out to be the one that I was most interested in anyhow, bonus!  Cayenne Mayo, Tomato, Grilled onions and jalapenos, pepperjack cheese, and an onion ring filled with guac.  Yeah, sign me up!   

My friend and I decided to share a side, and while I pushed for one of the actual french fry concoctions, he asked if I wanted to share the Frito Pie.  Uh, I guess.  When the food arrived (after a few beers, naturally), the burger looked impressive.  I'm all about saving the best for last though so I tackled the Frito Pie first.  Eh, tasted just like Frito Pie.  I guess I shouldn't knock it since it tasted exactly what a Frito Pie should taste like, but I was hoping for a bit of ingenuity or something that might set it apart.  After cursing my friend for twisting my arm into ordering that and not one of their fry options, I bit into the burger.  I got exactly what I expected and wanted out of it:  greasy, flavorful, and messy.  I felt like a star of a Carl's Jr commercial, except not nearly as hot.  I had also ordered the 1/2 lb version instead of 1/3, and that wasnt necessary even though I ate the entire thing.

So all in all, the burger was very tasty, even though I still prefer places like Bachi, Fuku, and maybe even In N Out.  I wouldn't recommend the Frito Pie and would imagine their fries are probably pretty damn tasty (shakes fist at friend).   The service was friendly and prices were very reasonable which bumps my total score from a mid 3 to a 4.

I can't believe I ate here and didn't order a hot dog! I wasn't extremely hungry yet intrigued by the grill master fries mentioned in previous reviews. They were everything I had imagined and then some. The grilled onions were caramelized to perfection. The fries were fresh and crispy. The thousand Island dressing was tangy and sweet yet not overpowering. The melted cheese was the perfect amount not to smother the fries completely, I was in french fry heaven! The service was super friendly and fast. I will return to try more menu items!

In Vegas for work and wanted to find a place for a good burger. We yelped burgers & beer and this
place popped up. Figured it was off the tourist path we will give it a try. Holy Cow! So happy we did!!!  We had the sweetest waitress, Journey, she was so helpful with suggestions of customer favorites. We ordered a chili burger, the sage chili is amazing, chicken tenders, perfectly breaded & cooked & not over greasy, fried zucchini & onion rings. Let me tell you we left stuffed and happy. I will definitely make my way back in next time we are in town.

I just can't find it in me to give five stars to a hot dog joint, but there is none better.  The atmosphere is perfect and the staff are super friendly.  They make a great shake.  There is such a great variety of burgers, dogs and sides you could try something different every time you go.  I've been here a half dozen times and it never let's me down.

As a kid growing up in home were mom didn't work, we rarely ate hot dogs. She always cook for us. When we did picnic's at the lake, or camping which we did a lot in the summer months, we'd eat hot dogs roasted over an open flame. Chili cheese dogs came later, and I didn't get to experience gourmet dogs until my adult years. 

Today we tried Great Links, and I was surprised at the different variations of hot dogs. If you want new experience try this place. I had the 
Chicago dog with fried zucchini sticks. My husband ordered the chili cheese fries with the New York hot dog. 

The bun became soggy with the liquid from the relish? And when I went to pick mine up, it kinda fell apart in my hand, and with each bite, the toppings fell off and the hot dog came through the bottom of the bun. We watched the guy make them, so we know they were not sitting for a while, but still yet, who likes a soggy bun? 

The flavors of the peppers, pickle, tomato, onions, and green relish worked well together, the hot dog itself had a little snap to it, so I assume it was close to the real thing, however, I would try a different dog next time. As for the sides, the zucchini sticks were plentiful and had good crisp to them, but the chili on the fries did seem canned. 

For a hot dog, this place was just okay. I'd try it again, just because of the variety on the menu. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxed.

This is the best place in Vegas for a Dog, burger or sausage. 
I always get the Kilbasa/Chicago style & the Hot link/Philly style. Both are outstanding. The Pastrami cheese/southwest style is awesome, the burgers are great, and the tater tots with Las Vegas chili rocks.

I have ordered take out from here before & dined in. I have not been disappointed in any way, shape, or form. The food is so delicious! Fresh, quality ingredients! Great customer service! You will NOT regret it. The Philly Steak Sandwich & Ortega Cheeseburger is superb!

So we decided to give this place a try knowing that it has some previous complaints on service.....well same old story and same old song and dance.  Very poor service, Greasy Fries and a tit-for-tat brouhaha between the server and the cook resulted in a 1.5 Hour wait and no food to boot. Lame service and the cook and server need to go. The owner came out and tried to apologize but the damage has been done. He should have offer a free meal for the 4 of us but he didn't go that extra mile so I'm posting what I think of this place. 
What restaurant serves the side (fries and ring) before the Burger come out? That was our first clue Sherlock, and then the marathon wait begins.......................Nothing! So we left and went to Farmers Boys and got our meal in a reasonable time, Really FB beat you losers out?

greasy fries and very slow service. never again.......

I enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. My fries were burnt but I didn't care as much because I didn't want to eat them anyway, and my sandwich was still dry even after I added mayo. Their hot dogs were great as I tried some from my husband's  order. I'd go back again to try other items but will def say something if we get burnt fries again.

Found this place on yelp after craving a good hot dog. Good food, Nice atmosphere, and great staff. I tried the Atlanta Slaw Dog. I loved the homemade slaw. Definitely going back to get another and try the other hot dogs

This place is amazing. Always doing a great job with customer service and great food.
I would highly recommend. Many different variations of hot dogs. Sausage. Burgers. Fry's.
This place is off the chain..

Are you in the mood for some hot dogs or some other American diner food? Do you want to watch TV while you dine? Then Great Links is the place.

Firstly this particular Great Links is not that big so it can fill up pretty fast. I like how you can sit on the bar stools and watch them prep your meal. Everyone is friendly that works here. They have some TVs up showing sports stuff. Today was nascar and they even were having some specials in celebration.

Now for what really matter the food! I try to stop by great links every time I drive by. Go for their hot dogs or sausages. My brother usually gets the burgers. Today I went for a Reuben and it was tasty! I love the rye bread they use and the cheese melted perfectly on the corned beef. As a side I got the natural cut fries. I just love the darkness of their fries. And if you want you can get shoestring or tater tots. The root beer they have is good! They serve beer as well I believe.

I give 4 stars for Great Links classic American food and great service!

Love this place!! Since I lived the first 24 years of my life in the Mid-West (Detroit area)  I really miss this type of food/restaurants.  This place is great.  Thankfully its across town from me so I don't get there often or I'd have to buy a Radio Flyer wagon to carry my fat a$$ around!
Pretty good hotdog. Don't usually eat them. Husband loves them he came out very happy, didn't feel sick after eating it. Ordered the natural fries they were delicious. Will come back.
Wow! This was amazing! I had the Las Vegas Chili Dog and it was so unique and good! The workers were super friendly and will definitely go back again

You know what's funny about this place?  It is bacically a fast food diner place.  Something where you just expect some good greasy food in a no frills atmosphere.   But, I got a little of the opposite.  Please let me explain.

So if you went to a fancy place you are paying for good food, but you are paying for the "sizzle in the steak."  You are paying for the atmosphere.

In a diner like this you are paying for good simple food done right.  No frills.

Even thought this place is not a fancy place - you are kinda paying to get a cool diner style low key joint with some good ol'fashioned diner style food.  This place does have an appeal.  A hominess.  It has a personality, and it is personable.  It is a happy place.  This really does add to the appeal.

The food.  Well, it was good.  The BLT had plenty of thick cut bacon.  The chili cheese fries were smothered and the cheese was melty.  The Italian beef had plenty of beef.  The Au Jus was good.  If you like good food off the grill... this is the place.  In the "something different" challenged northwest part of the valley this is a place worth a visit.

The only complaint was the Italian Beef bun was mushy... not wet... it was mushy. 

"I hope this makes sense."
Yelped milkshakes and found this place. Excellent shake, food and service. They definitely have it all together. We will be returning!

I found this place on Yelp when I was looking for a good place for our group of 7 to eat lunch. Our group order the Ruben which was very good and I had the jalape√±o burger and it was one of the best burgers. The chili cheese fries and fried pickles were outstanding. The place was packed and I can see why, the food is delicious and the whole group was very happy.

The chili fries and burger we got were very good, prices were good as well. However, my review is mainly for the service. The young lady that waited on us was very friendly, efficient, and overall did an excellent job. I watched her handle one rude group of people after another without batting an eye. I don't know when it became acceptable to treat other people this way, but this young lady certainly didn't let it bother her!  It's unfortunate that people are jerks but she did an AMAZING job!
If you want to eat a good burger or hot dog this is the place and the staff is always friendly and cool

I just had the most amazing grilled cheese sandwhich here! I was craving an egg sandwhich so the staff were very kind to let me add a fried egg to my grilled cheese with tomato on Rye. They don't usually serve breakfast on weekdays, but they let me special order since they were not busy. It is not everyday that you find a place that is a hole in the wall greasy spoon with good home cooked food!! Seriously, best grilled cheese/egg sandwhich I have ever had. They also have amazing fries and rootbeer floats!!

It had been over 18 months since my last visit here, and, based on my most recent experience, I'm pleased to restore a 5th star!  Cheese Fries that were smothered with mellow Cheese Sauce was a yummy side.  A Boar's Head Kraut Dog smeared with Heinz Yellow Mustard and ensconced in a blanket of Sauerkraut was suitably hot, and each bite yielded a very nice, audible snap.  A fully dipped grilled Italian Beef Sandwich with grilled Green Peppers tasted very good, but I liked it better with some ketchup.

Service at the counter was very good and friendly in a casual atmosphere.  Great Links is a fine haven for topnotch comfort food!

So everything I've ate here has been well cooked, seasoned, and delicious! That goes for cheeseburgers, Philly cheesesteaks, chili cheese fries, fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, etc. I love the fact I can get an ice cold beer also. My only complaint is sometimes it takes a little long but in the end it's worth the wait. My aunt and uncle love the place so much they had a private party there for their anniversary. Hahaha! Keep it up Great Links and my belt will get tighter.

My boyfriend and I "used" to eat at this place all the time, almost on a weekly basis, but after our experience yesterday no more! It's a shame because the food it great, however I've never had such horrible service in my life! We generally always call our order in for pick-up because at lunch time this tiny space is always busy. Yesterday was no exception. We were told the food would be ready to be picked up in 10 to 15 minutes after placing our order. We walk into the shop 15 minutes after placing our order. Not a single employee, server nor cook even acknowledged our presence. After standing at the counter together for 10 minutes and having both servers come behind the counter and completely ignore us while pouring draft beers, we sat down seeing as they were quite busy. Mistake one was not welcoming customers, avoiding eye contact and essentially ignoring us. Another 10 minutes of trying to get someones attention an older gentleman came out from the back (owner?) started to ask us what we needed and then proceeded to cut off my answer as another couple walked in the door. He was much more concerned with this couple for some inexplicable reason. "do you want to be seated/served outside, a place at the counter, wait for table?" Wow, and this guy wouldn't even let me complete a sentence. Rude beyond belief. Mistake two was not letting your customer fishing speaking before cutting them off to address someone else.After another few minutes my boyfriend grabbed some cups so we could at least have a drink while waiting. Now more waiting, I get up to refill my tea and come back to see my boyfriend at the counter with one of the servers. Come to find out our food was bagged and sitting there THE. ENTIRE.TIME. Ice cold greasy slop in a bag. Then the server( LISA) had the nerve to act like it was our fault! Had a complete attitude as she grudgingly offered to have our food remade. After sitting there for 30+ minutes, no thanks, she then turns back to that older guy and almost whines about our unhappiness, that was the third mistake. We didn't even wait for him to say anything but walked out with our ice cold food. On arriving home and unwrapping it we found that they hadn't cut the sandwiches, did not put any napkins in the bag and neglected to give us the fry sauce we requested. I really believe we shouldn't have been charged for the food. At $26.13 for a lunch for two it's not exactly a cheap place. We were there yesterday, May 2nd between 12:45 pm and 1:30 pm.

If you are throwing your calorie counter out the window this is the place to do it. The food is very good and the prices are very competitive.  Our server was personable and made us feel very comfortable. The staff is friendly with each other which makes for a more relaxed environment where we felt comfortable taking our time eating and enjoying our lunch. The portions are very generous. We will be back.

Their dogs have that snap when you bite into them and have a nice spice to it. 

Try their coleslaw dog, the spiciness of their dog + the cooling taste of slaw + the 100+ degree Vegas dry heat = nirvana

I'm craving their Chicago dog right now.

Came here based on the reviews. Really good service, the Italian fries are bomb. The breaded mushrooms had a doughy taste perhaps taken out of the fryer al little too soon. The chili cheese dog was ok, I assumed the cheese would have been melted but it wasn't. This place is ok I guess

This is a grill, cooked to order in open kitchen. This is a great place to meet a friend, have a cold beer, great dog, watch a game, tease the staff (they flip it right back).
Now this isn't a family atmosphere, or a place designed with high end service or patient wait staff... this is an old school grille...like it should be.
Try a Mob Boss Dog with Italian Fries..and a freaking cold beer..  

Good job guys!
Usually love the food. Hubs wants to rate a two. I gave three because of service. They were out of ice and had a ton of to go orders but robert (server) made everything flow well
